Best dessert ever after ANY MEAL. If you're ever feeling depressed, this is what you have. If you're feeling happy, this is what you have. If you're feeling like celebrating something, THIS IS WHAT YOU HAVE!
Come here sometimes to get some Delicious treats... they always good.... And the staff is always Friendly

Holy crap, you are delicious. I don't know how I waited so long to stop by this truck. They stop by my campus every Monday but I only just visited today. For $6, I ordered the lesser known liege wafel. They give you the first dinges free but of course I splurged and went for three toppings: fresh strawberries, whipped cream, and spekuloos spread. ABSOLUTELY SINFUL. It's obvious why they list spekuloos as their "favorite" dinges. Imagine your favorite gingerbread cookie or Golden Grahams cereal in syrup form. Add in a little extra cinnamon, maybe a little nutmeg, and then PERFECTION. Believe me when I say it rivals Community's maple butter syrup. Nutella and ordinary maple syrup pale in comparison so if you only get one dinges, be sure it is this!My wafel was soft, sweet, warm, and chewy. Even with the toppings, it was not overpoweringly sweet, making it an OK option for breakfast and dessert alike.Pro tip: follow their Twitter for a free dinges. They have a different prompt everyday so if you tell a silly joke, give your best celebrity impression, wear a certain color, etc you get another dinges free! Do the math: one wafel, two dinges, five dollars.

Waffle + Pulled Pork + ColeSlaw = Killer lunch! KABLAM!This combo runs out fast, and will set you back about eight bucks. Not something I could eat everyday, which is fine. This means I can come back every Monday and get my mid-afternoon sweets fix. Thank you for coming to DUMBO.
I LOVE WAFELS & DINGES.  They smell so heavenly that every time you walk past one you can't help but find yourself debating which flavors and toppings to try today.  Best food truck in the city!

This place deserves the praise it receives.  The waffles are delicious and the sauces are equally good and make it that much better.  This is the perfect breakfast food and everyone that i know that had it with me agrees 100%.  You need to come and try this place out.  Im not even that big of a waffle person, but I will actually "crave" this at times which is a pretty rare thing for me to say.  I will now start to track them down.

Holy Jesus, best waffles ever hands down. They always make their waffles deliciously and with unfailing consistency. The servers are always so friendly and will always try to broach conversation with you unless it's too crowded.Oh and did I mention the Spekuloos? Ermahgerd. So good.

One of the most amazing things I have ever eaten. I love waffles, but have never had them as a dessert dish. Why oh why have I never had warm fresh waffles with ice cream as a dessert?? What have I been doing with my life? I had the one with spekuloos spread and whipped cream. I added strawberries. One of the most amazing things I have ever eaten. I also love their hot chocolate. Not made with powder but with thick melted belgian chocolate. To die for.

This place is crazy good!  I was in NYC for a short vacation, and was looking for one of their trucks not too long after leaving the plane.  After several days of following them on Twitter, for numerous reasons, I wasn't able to try it.  I was certain I wasn't gonna try the waffles.On my second to last day there, as I was walking around, I just happened to stumble upon one of their trucks, not even trying to look for them.  Not sure what I wanted, I described to one of the workers what I was looking for, and he said he knew what to make.  It was one of their waffles with chocolate and strawberries, and it was soo good!The next time I'm in NYC, I'm definitely gonna look for them again!

Got the Brussels waffle with spekuloos, ice cream, and walnuts. The waffle itself was quite possibly the best waffle I have ever eaten. the spekuloos spread was very sweet but they didn't put too much on the waffle so it didn't overpower the waffle. The ice cream was pretty hard, and I probably should not be eating ice cream outside in the winter, but it was creamy and rich. All in all, it was a great waffle.
Favorite little stop by Brooklyn Bridge subway station. Great food for on the go! Sometimes you might even see a show. Mostly break dancers but its cool. Live entertainment & a nice quick lunch!

I LOVE this truck.I find it dangerous walking past it. I've had their waffles a few times and with different toppings.The liege waffle is definitely my favorite...light, fluffy and sweet and perfect for holding toppings. Strawberries, whipped cream, chocolate and ice cream are terrific on a waffle but the spekuloos is definitely the topping to try...delicious and a definitely Beglian-esque.

Yes finally, an actually GOOD waffle truck.  Good would not be doing this place justice.. it is probably the best waffle truck  I have ever had.  You have got to get yourself a liege waffle with the house special gingerbread spread.  I am not a gingerbread lover, but this spread definitely has crack mixed into it.  It is addictively good.  It tastes something like a sweetly spiced creamy peanut butter.. but without so much of the peanutty flavor and instead a creamy mystery flavor?? I really can't describe what it tastes like but the consistency is that of a soft creamy peanut butter.  Just trust me and try it.  This is what makes the wafels and dinges truck go from a delicious waffle to an amazing one!

First time I saw the truck, it was right in front of Seaport. My friend and I shared a strawberry waffle. It was good. The second time when I met my friend at 14th st, we saw the truck again. This time we tried it with the spekuloos! Loved it!

OMG. Ok, I hate being a slave to the Food Network and going to eat where they tell me. But these are the BEST waffles I've ever had in my life. Drive to LA, please? There's a reason why Bobby Flay lost on his throwdown (well he always loses, but that's besides the point). Probably the one because-it-was-on-the-Food-Network-I'm-going-to-go-try-it mentioned place that I've tried that did NOT disappoint.I don't even care that the truck changes location every day, I would hunt this truck down until I find it (and that's exactly what I did, for two nights in a row).Liege wafel. With the spekuloos (sp?) spread and strawberries.Don't even think about it. Go NOW. Mouthgasm.
the hot chocolate here is the BEST.i just got the basic wafel and it was of course delicious.i def recommend stopping by this truck. the people working were super kind too!

I've had wafles and Dinges multiple times, and I'll have to say my favorite item is the mini wafelini.  The price is cheap @ 3 bucks and its just enough for a light but satisfying snack.  Basically it's a baby wafel with 2 petite slices of bananas and strawberry. Perfect for a sping/summer dayIf I'm a little more hungry, I usually get the liege wafel (nice and sweet)  with chocolate and strawberries.  Again, if you stick to the mini wafelini or just get one or two toppings, the price isn't too bad.  Just don't go overboard on the toppings, otherwise the price can add up quickly.
Omg!!!!!!! I love the truck by the Brooklyn Bridge.  They guy that created my waffle was awesome!!! I added chocolate and strawberries. So good!! Please try!!

Best waffles  I have had ! I got the one with apple & cinnamon and my boyfriend got one with chocolate and whipped cream. We went to the van at the Union square holiday market. I definitely  recommend!!

There are two musts at this truck of deliciousness:1. Liege waffle (you can get the other kind of waffle anywhere else)2. Speckuloos topping (I thought it as Nutella + 1)If you have a sweet tooth, do it a favor and visit.Twitter.com/waffletruck is how I found its location on a Sunday. Line wasn't too bad for me.

Found the truck right next to Num Pang Sandwich Shop and had to try it, even though I was full already.Not usually a fan of sweets, but the liege is super tasty. I would get it with fruit next time instead of the speculoos cookie butter - waaay too cavity-inducing for me.

I have been coming here for many years and this is one of the few places that truly deserves a 5 star rating. I have only tried the dessert waffles and they are simply amazing. I usually have the liege waffle with Speculoos, fresh strawberries and whip cream. The waffles alone are spectacular. If you are in NYC this is worth a try and you will not be disappointed.

Good yummy and unique waffle!  But expensive for a waffle. I didn't know about this place until my friend and I were walking to the MET and found this waffle truck in the middle of Central Park.  She told me that they were featured on the Food Network's Throwdown with Bobby Flay.  And I recently watched a Best Thing I Ever Ate episode featuring Wafles n Dinges's WMD waffle.I got the Throwdown waffle, which came with speculoos (spelling?) and whipped cream.  Speculoos is basically like an almond butter spread (it's not almond butter).  It's made from some European type of cookie and is made like you would make peanut butter or almond butter.  It has a ginger-bread type of taste, although it's a little difficult to describe.  You just have to try it for yourself!Waffle was delicious.  But the cold NYC weather made my waffle cold so I didn't get to enjoy it in it's hotness.

They are really nice people! I luckily found them when they were at Astor place! I got a Soft and Chewy Waffle with Spekuloos (like a soft peanut butter/caramel sauce). It was yummy! It was a nice dessert. I was chewing for a long time though. See you again sometime!
This has the most incredible waffles that I've ever had.  Everything here is good.  I prefer the liege waffle without ice cream, but every time I've been here my day has been better.

It's true. It's all true. Believe the hype and get your waffle on. And don't forget the dinges. I was on the quest for waffles when the blizzard was starting to hit. Could only make it to the cart at Central Park only to find they were closing down because of the blizzard. Better for them to be safe so they can keep serving the closest thing to heaven on earth.  Had to return 2 days later so that my trip to NYC could be complete. I went for the waffle that starts with an L. (can't remember the name of it) topped it with nutella, spekulos, strawberries and bananas, and one scoop of ice cream. It was ALL good!

I am salivating just remembering my experience.  I visited the cart in December when it was by the Bodies Exhibit.I had the Throwdown Wafel.  It was AMAZING.  The spekuloos spread was incredible and I have kept myself from ordering it online simply for the sake of my waistline (as I do not believe it is advised to eat the ENTIRE container in one sitting, which I probably would have to, plain.)

Eat it when it's hot! My friend and I shared the liege waffle with spekuloos, strawberries, bananas and nutella, with a last touch of powdered sugar. Very sweet, but it's also because of the toppings we chose! My friend ordered the Belgian hot chocolate and it was very thick, rich and sweet, but deliciously warming in the cold, rainy day.

Still five stars! I would like to add to my review- SPEKULOOS ICE CREAM IS THE BOMB! Superbly AWESOME! And I am really enjoying all the carts hidden around the city. Makes it easier to enjoy my favorite food cart!

This is the best waffle i have ever had, light and crispy, it was perfect.  Plus how many places could you get pulled pork on a waffle, and with a coolicle.  The sandwich was awesome, so tasty.  I can't wait to go back and try a dessert waffle.

Finally used livingsocial coupon! well worth it. The wafel would been perfect if it was right of the hot press! but what i didn't like was the big crystals of undissolved sugar crystals.. :( otherwise it wasn't too sweet and very good. too bad the truck moves around every day.. :(

I finally arrived...at the Wafles and Dinges truck! Still stuffed from a dinner of Thai food, my friends and I decided to top off the night with some dessert.And, oh was dessert had. I had the S'mores wafle, loaded with chocolate and marshmallows. My friend had a strawberry wafle, which was as refreshing as it was good.The only downside is the price. While delicious, it's hard to justify $7 for a loaded waffle.

Next time, maybe the topping-laden wafel will do it for me? Don't get me wrong, the Bruxellois-style wafel with strawberries and powdered sugar was good. But was it $5 worth of good? I'm not so sure. My Belgian companion and I agreed that the waffle could have been cooked for another minute or so, which is funny because it's timed by a machine. A tasty snack from a truck, though I suspect that the all-out, topping-heavy waffles might be the best way to do this.Update: second visit yields better waffle. Light with crispy edges, quite nice...the price, however, still seems steep to me.

First and foremost, if you see this truck, GO.It's THAT good.After passing by this truck at its 14th Street location for a couple of weeks, I made the decision to stop by tonight after reading all the positive reviews on Yelp.  And, boy, am I happy that I did.For dinner I tried their BBQ Pulled Pork Wafel.  I was skeptical that it was called the "best pulled pork on the East Coast," but after one bite, I was convinced.  The pulled pork is tender and flavorful, and the BBQ sauce is sweet and a little spicy.  The coleslaw was tasty, and the waffle did a great job of soaking up all the barbecue flavor.  Later, I went back for a Throwdown Wafel.  (Luckily the truck was just downstairs of my apartment.)  I really wanted to try their famous Spekuloos spread, which is made from traditional Belgian gingerbread cinnamon cookies.  And holy cow is it heavenly!  And because it was so close to their closing time, they were making all the waffles fresh.  Hot-off-the-griddle waffle + Spekuloos spread = AWESOME!I'm now looking forward to Wafels and Dinges' weekly stop on 14th Street... and I may be tracking down the truck (or one of their carts) if I get a craving on the days in between!

Lesson learned from this truck: Liege style waffle is the only kind worth eating, all others might as well just be warm bread..dont overkill with toppings, let the waffle shine some!  The gingerbread spread sealed the deal I wish I bought a bottle to go..they need a storefront asap

I absolutely love their Liege Waffle with strawberries, nutella and vanila ice cream. The waffle has a perfect, crispy texture and the toppings are all fresh and yummy.  It's somewhat on the pricey side, but if you compare it to other famous waffel places in the city such as Petite Abeille, it is a great value. I will most definitely keep visiting them.

The Liège Wafel (this is the alternative to the Brussels which is more of an Eggo Waffle shape) was really soft and rich. I would recommend it 100%. Should try the other one, but the Liège is so good I am afraid too. You get one free topping (additional toppings extra) and I chose chocolate. I realized I should have gotten it with Spekuloos (a sweet honeylike spread). And actually the chocolate was a little overpowering. Next time I will get it with Spekuloos or maple syrup.Bottom line, if you want the Wafels & Dinges experience go with the Liège and the Spekuloos topping.

Yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum  yum The Liege (pronounced lee-EHJJ) wafel is sooo yum. It is crisp and chewy and sweet, with caramelized edges. I get it topped with spekuloos, bananas, strawberries and whipped cream. That should count as a serving of fruit, right? My only mistake was getting one to share with my piggy husband. Next time I will order one all for myself.The coffee is hit or miss. The first time I had it, it was great, but this time it was just okay with grinds at the bottom.You must try the spekuloos though. It's like a mix between "gingerbread and graham crackers" as described by the friendly wafel man. I buy the cookie version of this Belgian treat, called Biscoff. Maybe you've tried these cookies on a flight? Anyway, it's really good...as a cookie and as a spread!
So so good. Try a waffle with gingerbread sauce and whip cream. It's hard to walk passed this place.

Waffles Eatten:1. Nutella & Spekuloos2. BBq pulled porkOverall Taste - it's ok- Spekuloos (Graham cracker and marsh-mellow) was good but not $9 good- BBQ pulled pork - Too salty and made my waffle soggy.....BF and I felt Ihop or the infamous Waflle house would be a better $20 spent!
This is the best late night dessert you can get.  Try the Liege wafel with speculoos spread.  Just beware, the wafel is cheap but the dry cleaning bills add up.

YUMMY IS ALL I CAN SAY! Honestly we shouldn't have had stopped by after dinner but Im so glad we did. The waffles hit the spot between us 5 girls we shared 2 waffles after dinner and it was AMAZING!! We ordered one topped with ice cream and strawberries and another topped with nutella and peanut butter. My fav was the PB and Nutella. Ohhhhhh I'm drooling just thinking about this. Make sure you try this truck if you happen to see it in NYC

Whenever I run into this truck I can't stop myself! The waffles are great!I usually get the liege with a bunch of topping such as speculoos, fresh fruits, nutella and nuts. I could eat one all by myself but I'm usually forced to share...I've heard the brick and mortar is almost ready to go with some great new additions to the menu. Can't wait to check out their new stuff!

I'd been following them on Twitter for a while and kept meaning to track them down when, one freezing evening, I stumbled upon their cart at the Union Square Holiday Market. Words cannot express how wonderful these waffles are. Consuming them constitutes a religious experience. I'm not kidding.I had one with Nutella and whipped cream. I'm going to return as soon as humanly possible to try this spekuloos stuff and I'll report back, hopefully with good news. As for pricing, I had enough cash on me to cover it (and I barely carry any cash), so IMO that's pretty cheap.

This evil truck parks in front of 375 Hudson every.single.Tuesday.Sure, they don't force me to get a delicious wafel covered in fruit, chocolate syrup and powdered sugar... but that sweet, sweet smell. It lures you in. As do the often-attractive wafel boys. It's probably mostly the wafels though.Next thing I know, I'm sitting at my desk, syrup on my nose, powdered sugar covering my shirt (seriously, one gust of wind and it's all over)... and I think to myself "maybe a wafel for lunch, too?"

After seeing the Wafels and Dinges food truck throwdown with (my man) Bobby Flay I had to a taste their authentic liege wafels. Bobby Flay, although I love him dearly, could not compete with these heavenly liege waffles. The men were super enthusiastic & explained everything I needed to know about the waffles & their accompanying dinges.I opted for a liege waffle with spekuloos spread: think nutella & peanut butter of the Flemish sort its smooth like peanut butter, but is made out of gingerbread cookies & spices. It was sweet and melted beautifully on the waffle with the powdered sugar. The waffle was chewy, dense & deliciously sweet. My advice: this truck is on the move, so if you spot it, consider yourself lucky, and enjoy a waffle!

My absolute favorite food truck. It's impossible to walk past a truck without getting a wafel. I like ordering the liege wafel with syrup and whipped cream, because although the spekuloos (cookie butter) is amazing, it can be a little cloying when spread all over a sugar-glazed wafel. If you check out the twitter feed, you can find both the trucks daily locations and the secret code of the day. Each wafel comes with one free dinges (toppping), and your knowledge of the secret code gets you access to a second free dinges!! It's a win-win. A wafel and an ice coffee from the W & D truck is impossible to get wrong.
Nice waffle desert selections, but the guy at the stand at Central Park, 58th Street is not nice.  I don't think he likes his job..
If you see this truck, GET SOME WAFFLES. Especially the vanilla with icecream on top, you won't regret it.

I saw this truck as I was walking nearby Union Square. I had heard and read some really great things about Wafels & Dinges so I knew I had to give it a try. While at first I was a little reluctant to hand over $7 for small dessert, as soon as I bit into my waffle I was sold. I ordered a liege waffle (they also have a belgian waffle, but I'd heard the liege waffle was the way to go) with a whole bunch of different toppings. Make sure to get what they call the WMD, which means you get an unlimited amount of dinges (toppings). My waffle was covered in nutella, strawberries, bananas, and whipped cream, and they have a whole bunch of other toppings. I would recommend trying the spekuloos spread, which is this wonderfully sweet topping that I don't even know how to describe. I was also really impressed by the service. The line moved quickly and the staff was super friendly, taking the time to chat and joke with me. It was pretty refreshing to meet some people who seemed like they actually enjoyed their job.

This is one of the few food stops in NYC that I actually wake up and crave and say I WANT THAT!I originally found the truck on 60th and Broadway but have followed it to its many different deviations from that spot the past few months and am now super elated that I can walk from my apartment to 60th and columbus to get my fix!My go to is the liege wafel with bananas, spekuloos, and powdered sugar! YUM! The liege is soft, chewy and sweet, the spekuloos is heavenly to me and tastes like liquid graham crackers with a peanut butter consistency, and well the bananas are healthy right?Also the guys working there are usually pretty funny and always friendly.So, yummy unique wafels + funny guys serving it up = i'll take it :)

Coming up from the 6 train onto 23rd in the early AM, this truck was a vision to behold. I made my way down there for lunch. The pulled pork was decent. Nothing amazing but the wafel makes the meal. The packaging was even interesting, with a gauge along the side of the box to determine if you have enough to wafel to share. I went back for a wafel sundae and it too was a most pleasurable. This trucks return to my part of town can only come too soon.

Belgium waffles - Mine was made to order with yes....ALL THE TOPPINGS!!!!   Sooo good....But I don't know if this is a great review of their Waffles since I'll spend my time talking about...Spekuloos.  THis spread is SOOOOOO Good.  It looks and has the consistency of Peanut Butter but it's soooo much better.  It's this sweet gingerbread tasting spread (made from the Spekuloos cookies).  I thank you Waffles and Dinges for introducing me to this awesome spread and selling it by the jar.  I spread it on my bread for breakfast and take a secret spoonful of it at night when my husband isn't looking.Next time you are buying Waffle and Dinges make sure to ask for Spekuloos and buy a jar too!

Tasty.  The thing about waffles for me though, is that they rarely go beyond just tasty into "incredible" territory.  Wafels & Dinges sure had tasty wafels, and their assorted "dinges" or toppings are sure to please many.But unless it's amazing, or a lot cheaper, I'm not sure I'm hyped up enough to consistently shell out $5-6 for a cart waffle.  I wouldn't turn one down though.

Wafels & Dinges.....a waffle that is crazy good, had the waffle topped with melted chocolate - I shared it with a date and only cost $5, perfect price and a great dessert after a date night. A food truck staple parked late nights near Astor Place on weekends.

Spekuloos Spread. Perfect for these waffles. Such a wonderful dessert. I recommend the strawberry and Spekuloos.Why so much Spekuloos love? (1) It is truly delicious. Imagine Cinnamon Nutella, but way better. Peanut Butter texture, which brings me to number two. (2) I am allergic to all nuts and can never eat peanuts, or especially peanut butter. My newfound Spekuloos is my peanut butter substitution. I love it. It tastes too good. Can't wait to get a full bottle (for free!) after checking in on foursquare 10 times.
Best waffle in New York. After eating this waffle all other waffles will cause your eyes to fill with sorrow and disappointment. Do not pass up. Enough said.

I don't know why I write this review. I'm on twitter stalking their call sign @waffletruck and a fan on their facebook page. The mere scent of nutella and strawbrerries triggers a Pavlovian response. It's an obsession that's not rational nor healthy. Sure, I've made my share of waffles at home and tasted a few at state fairs but, to explain following a 46 year old truck painted in the Belgian national colors, is truly odd but NY.I always come upon the vehicle with glee and excitement. Toiling at the waffle maker, the attendant asks me which waffle.... and before he completes his sentence, I retort, "Liege with nutella, strawberries with a dollop of  whip cream" Liege, by the way, is a waffle that's crispy on the outside but chewy within. I watched eagerly while a line forms in front to order. Invariably, at times, I overhear, "I'll have what he's having" Done. Happy, Enough said.

What a nice treat!!!  My family and I were walking our dog by the Guggenheim and we walked into the Waffles & Dinges food truck.    We ordered the traditional Belgium with strawberry and cream. In addition we purchased their coffee, better then most in the area and well priced.In the area on Saturday and Sunday, I will be back and will try a few different items.

There is nothing not to like about this place. The spekuloos is, no joke, a magical creation that I crave all the time. I've only had "de throwdown wafel," which comes with spekuloos and whipped cream. It's so good, I have a hard time branching out, but I will one of these days. The waffle is just perfectly crispy. I don't know how they do it!On top of the fantastic food, the guys that work in the trucks are all so friendly and hilarious. I love how you can do certain things to get free dinges, like recite a quote from a movie or something like that. "Like" them on facebook or follow them on twitter for all of the fun.

Oh my God, this is amazing. Approximately a little more than 5 inches by 4 inches of delicious strawberry speculoos goodness. Crisp at the edges and ridges, chewy warm and delicious...a perfect winter day treat. I am definitely on the speculoos bandwagon. Rich, smooth, creamy, yum. A little bit like ginger thins, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, and peanut better but better than the sum of its parts...whatever they happen to be. I'm not here to question, just to enjoy. Tiny bit of caramelization and powdered sugar here and there is probably not doing anything good for my waistline...I can't imagine speculoos is healthy, nothing that tastes this good is ever healthy but I really couldn't care less at the moment. With your $6 price tag for 2 toppings, first one free, and your yummy (likely fattening) goodness, it's probably best that you're so difficult to track down Wafels & Dinges truck. The only drawbacks are the same with any mobile food. There's no where to sit, it's kind of hard to eat without utensils and it's a little messy regardless, NYers are rightfully upset that you're blocking the sidewalk, and speculoos sticks to the roof of your mouth (but no worse than peanut butter does). So that last one doesn't really count...I'm having a bit of an obsession with speculoos right now.OK, review over. Time to savor...

Finally got a chance to try the liege wafel and it was tasty! The texture of the wafel definitely is different from the standard Belgium Waffles you have at your local diner, which uses a batter while the former a dough (embedded with these special sugar cubes that add crunch, crisp and taste). Had the Speckuloos (speck-ku-lo) spread and the Dulce de Leche sauce (on the side). The Speckuloo spread was great, but it has the texture of peanut butter (and the taste of ginger-gramham crackers) so it's smart to have a drink handy in order to gobble the entire wafel down. It's quite a heavy tasting combo, but something to try with the Wafel & Dinges Truck -come on, it's their specialty! The Dulce de Leche sauce wasn't necessary because the thick caramelize sauce made the combo even more rich and sticky. Next time, perhaps adding some whipped cream or some fruit would lighten the Speckuloo + Liege experience. I'd also just go for the liege on it's own in the future. The (Persian - we learned - ) guy taking the order at the Trader Joe's location was flirty, fun and a hit with costumers who were lined up (especially the ladies). He made me laugh and I gave him the "ok, to date my twin."  Ha.  Great dessert to end the night after Hill County Chicken (tho stuffed as you can imagine)!

Been here 2-3 times already at both of their Central Park stations.First time was over by apple/the zoo around 5pm on a cold winter day with a group of friends who decided to go to apple/toy store. I wanted to try them since we were already over there. Yummm~ I got the hot Belgium chocolate & the liege waffel [what dingie I forget] My friend got a skewered mini liege with whole strawberries I seem to recall. It was awesome just enjoying the hot Belgium chocolate while I waited for my friends to come out.The latest time was with my aunt & cousin during August this year. We walked through central park and passed the zoo. I was looking for the same stand again but I think I found their other stand. All I know it was behind this huge metal spider on the sidewalk & there were horse-drawn carriages at the circle. I got the mini liege wafel this time, though no skewer and tiny chopped up strawberry pieces. Sort of disappointed me on that thus why it lost a star. My aunt & cousin had the liege wafel & when they finish she told me that was very filling. Totally want to try their de Verdekke next time or if Central Park's have the savory versions which I don't believe they do.

I would love to rate the wafels at this truck but I never got the chance to order one.After waiting in line behind some 'ladies' (as the waffle man called them) I overheard each one asked for her phone number, which seemed inappropriate at best and creepy at worst.Needless to say, I left the line; I wish to buy my waffels in an environment that feels respectful to me as a woman, and from people who are not going to objectify me. Maybe NYC will be blessed with a non-misogynist waffle cart. Until then, I'll get my waffles from the freezer section.

This is probably my favorite food truck in the city.  All of the waffles are amazing, but the chewy waffle with speculoos is unbelievable.  Speculoos is a graham cracker-like cookie that has been turned into a spread.  Adding ice cream to this waffle makes it even better.  If you don't want to eat a whole waffle, they also sell mini-waffles.  This is a great place to grab desert, or just make it your whole meal.

For free dinges, Wafel truck, you asked me to provide cities in Belgium with odd names.  I said 'Sprouts' when I meant 'Brussels' and then I offered 'Eyeball' when I meant to say 'Antwerpen.'  Forgive me.  Please, now give me my free dinges.  Thanks for dragging us out to the wafel truck, ck.  I only came because I was a little drunk but it was totally worth it.

I drop by St. Mark quite often..and i usually spot the Waffle truck...but never bother to try it...and boy was i wrong!!!After having shabu shabu tonight with my friend...i decided to have another dessert after dinner..my shabu shabu came with ice cream....lol....so i brought the WMD..i think thats what its called....holy mother......its sooo yummy and goooood!I was kinda of sad that i wasnt able to eat it immediately as the waffle went from warm to cold when i got home...and they ran out of to-go boxes..so they covered it with foil, but i was super careful not to drop it or anything....When i got home..i actually microwaved it...LOL~~ and the cream on top melted...XD but it was still yummy..even though it was so good...but it was a little too sweet...but hey...i dont eat this all the time...so a little "splurge" should be fine.....kaka....

omgeeeee, the most delicious waffle i've ever had...i go the cinco de mayo special: the Churro Waffle, topped w/ cinnamon and vanilla ice cream. soft and chewy waffle, it was so.. good...it was a bit much for 1 person though, i didn't feel too good after i finished it... too much sugar. but i would order it again in a heartbeat.

The Liege wafle is probably the best waffle I've ever had and the spekuloos spread is amazing. I can completely understand why they recommend it over the rest- it's just so much better! I wish I knew where to get that spread or how to make it because I would have it every day, but for now I will just get it from the wafles cart.I love that they choose Monday to come to Columbia because it's the perfect thing to have on the least fun day of the week. I wish, however, that they were here every day but then I'd probably weigh 400 pounds from eating there all the time!The Brussels wafle is also excellent, but I much prefer the chewy texture of the Liege to the light crispiness of the Brussels. Also, if you follow them on Facebook, they tell you how to get a free dinges every day, which is always nice to have.

so like I said in my profile I have been judging food since I was in the womb and let me tell you something wafels and dinges is my favorite yummy snack/dinner/breakfast food dish thing ever :)   I have never experienced a bad anything with this place . the waffels are yummy and tasty and the toppings add to my never ending orgasm ... I wont lie I kinda stalk the truck and I always buy two one for the walk to the car/train and the other for when i get home .
i like it cuz is not too sweet.i will try the unlimited topping next time.

Oh, how I love this truck! The spekuloos spread alone is worth tracking them down. But seriously: a piping hot, buttered waffle, with a schmear of spekuloos? It does not get any better, people. My only comment would be that unless you LOVE, LOVE, LOVE powdered sugar, just ask them to skip that if you're wearing dark clothes and are less than coordinated/graceful. 'Cause, me? Me, I end up with powdered sugar drifting down the front of my sweater. It's not a fashion forward look, that.

What a way to start a morning off!!  I had a wafel with strawberries, bananas, blueberries, and vanilla ice cream and I was delighted!  I don't know what they put in the waffle batter but it is phenomenally delicious!!   I highly recommend the speculos spread and ice cream.  I tasted both after I already ordered my waffle and wished I had included those on my order!The iced coffee, however, is not good at all, regardless of what the vendor tells you.

The most amazing waffles and the most amiable service ever!I had a waffle with their special spread on one side of the waffle and dulce on the other side of the waffle. Topped with bananas and whip cream and I had the warmest waffle made with love-mmmm! My mate had a waffle with vanilla ice cream on top and whip cream. We shared their hot cocoa. The waffle was crisp on top, dense and sweet on its own. The aroma is the best. The hot Cocoa was good but it was too much sweet going on with the meal. It was smooth but rather on the sweet side, unlike Jaques Torres' richly decadent Chocolate. The good news is they offer more in terms of drinks like water, coffee and tea. ill ask about that next time. altogether the items came up to 16 bucks total. not bad considering all we got. The waffle was pretty good and I think next time I will try a different kind of waffle with more fruit and ice cream. They have some interesting names of their trucks and the meaning of the names on the side if you look. The people are so much fun and give you a free topping based on their Facebook trivia. They take card at the location by columbus circle with a 6 dollar minimum which is awesome , and not hard to meet considering what you'd want to put on your waffles. Bottom line, I love the idea of a place where I can get a waffle to go. Their spread is creamy and delicious (i prefer it over the dulce) and the fruit is fresh. Great place to meet funny people with a smile, humorous, and who seem to like what they do for the most part while getting a great feed on a waffle. I'm all about desserts and breakfast - my two favorite meals of the day! Wafles and dinges has succeeded in making me a happy gal, looking for more as soon as I can. Love to hunt down their trucks! It's so much fun!

Yeah. It was amazing. I shared a throwdown with my wife. We regretted not getting another one. We finished it all in about 3 minutes. Nothing really more to add since everyone knows they have the most amazing waffles.
Totally loved it! I went to Belgium last year and had waffles for all three meals during the day. This place is possibly the closest you get to those real Belgian waffles in the US!
I ordered "de Throwdown Wafel", a Belgian liege wafel with speculoos (a caramelized gingerbread spread...*drool*) and whipped cream.  Yes, definitely the right choice.  Sweet, warm, and soft.

Delicious!  I love the wafel with fudge and fruit toppings.  I can't seem to get enough of them.. I live in NJ but everytime I visit NY, I'm sure to get one!  They're my current obsession, though I do wish they'd cost a little less.

What's better than a nice walk through Central Park? A nice walk through Central Park paired with a wafel from wafel & dinges.I was very pleased to see that they were camped out nearby, and thought that I'd check out what all the hype was about. I opted for the Liege wafel with 2 dinges -- nutella, and bananas (**drooool). Needless to say, its yummy goodness soothed my soul and I may or may not have blacked out from its awesomeness...So here are the deets:- 5/5 stars for being at an awesome location- 4/5 stars for not having the full menu at this cart (I was mildly disappointed I couldn't eat my wafel with bacon syrup)- 4/5 for having really friendly but somewhat unorganized workers (they almost forget to take money from my friend as well as me) All in all, great experience. Will return for the bacon syrup!

I think this is going to be my new Monday morning tradition! The fluffy golden brown leige waffle was the perfect start to my day. The Spekuloos was just amazing and perfectly complimented the waffle. I was in waffle heaven. I could of used a glass of milk at the end, but alas, I was already on the subway. The staff on the truck were super friendly. I had a nice little conversation with them about the owner who is a huge cycling fanatic, hence the old school cycling videos that they show and the staff's Tour of France cap. I will definitely be back with an empty stomach next Monday!

I have been recommending Wafels & Dinges (or simply "the waffle truck") to just about everybody I know. Just the plain wafels are great, but even better when you add all the "dinges" -- whipped cream, toppings, etc.Also, do yourself a favor and try it with the spekuloos spread. I had never tried spekuloos before my first visit to the waffle truck, and its...life changing. It's about the consistency of nutella but it tastes sort of like graham cracker. Really, REALLY good.Also, the staff is always exceptionally friendly whenever I go. All in all, a visit to Wafels & Dinges is always a very pleasant experience.

So, I had the pleasure of finally tracking down the Wafels and Dinges cart, after one failed attempt, due to my inaccurate reading of their schedule/location.  And prior to yesterday, during all my trips to the city, I was not located near the truck's location.  So, yesterday, we discovered that it was going to be located just block's from my boyfriend's new job, so all the more reason to go.I had the liege wafel with nutella, and he had the bacon and maple one.  I loved the amount of nutella they put on.  I couldn't wait to eat it, and within seconds, i had "nutella face" (nutella all over my face).  I really enjoyed it.  The only complaint I have, is that I wished the wafel was warmer than it was.  Otherwise, still very good.  They made my boyfriend's wafel fresh, which was really nice, especially on a chilly day like yesterday.  He absolutely loved his.  Now that he knows the truck is generally in that area every week, he will definitely go more often (and it gives me another reason to go visit him at work!)
It's a great treat...it hits the spot, and it costs 5 bucks.  Enough said.

Before my first trip to the city I decided to look up some of the top street food that I might encounter. The one that stood out the most was Wafels & Dinges due to the Smokin Joees Pulled Pork BBQ Wafel. After all - If I were to come up with what I thought would be the worst combination of foods the BBQ waffle would be it - A waffle topped with pulled pork bbq, cole slaw then topped with sweet bbq sauce and a couple of kool-aid soaked pickles. - I had to try it.On our last day in town much to my surprise the truck was parked just outside our hotel. It was my lucky day.Long story short... the smokin joe waffle is FREAKIN AWESOME... well except for the pickles anyway but I hate kool-aid so I'm not holding it against them.

I'm not allowed near this truck anymore. The wafels are heavenly, the staff is very fun and attractive (a little eye candy with my dessert) and the comfort of eating something breakfasty in the afternoon is just a fantastic combination. They used to park outside my building, and have since relocated... this might be for the best, though I do miss them... terribly... which is why I might just stalk them a little on twitter.Come back

Sometimes after my morning Central Park jog, I'll take a break and grab a waffle at the Wafel & Dinges cart (Shhhh!D on't tell!). If I'm feeling somewhat healthy I'll go for the strawberry topping, if not I'll grab the spekuloos spread (glorious!). I'm sure I'll get the ice cream topping once the weather gets a little warmer, I can't resist! Everything tastes so fresh, warm and gooey!

Try "Da Bomb" with spekuloos! The spekuloos hardens under the ice cream to a chewy, almost candy-like texture. So delicious.... and who can't say no to beer flavored icecream? (hoegaarden) I sure can't.

the perfect i have to go to work but i have a hangover fooda poem by alli hyou know when you have those nightswhen perhaps you drank until you saw the morning lights?AND then you have to go to work the next day?You need the perfect food so you don't have you use your sick pay.And so we have wafels and dinges with their fleet of trucks and carts,It always makes me wonder when I can't find one of their parts,So on the days when i may have had too much to drink,And need something light to make me think,I look for the yellow truck with the wafels.The wafels all come with sauces,Just deciding which one may make you wander if you can cross it,I'm partial to their chocolaty goodness special stuff,Not just because it is special but also because it reminds me of fluff,Also an option.Each wafel is cooked to perfection and quite a snack or breakfast,Both of which you've clearly amassed.Clearly, I'm a big fan, But don't trust me because I write poems on yelp,Trust me because I like really good hangover food.This stuff is so filling and just works.I just wish they were downtown on the west side more often,So i can eat it when i need to instead of seeking out their carts on ediblecity.com.

These things are dangerous! And the fact that they tweet (@waffletruck) out their location everyday makes it worse. Because, if they are down the street from my house, i MUST go!!!They make the waffles fresh on the truck and have a unique assortment of toppings (dinges).Obvi, my favorite is SPEKULOOS which is this bomb spread made out of gingerbread and graham cracker cookies. OMFG!!!! I die!No but srsly, these are like a meal on their own.I'm getting hungry writing about them. OY!

Wafel truck, I love you again! After a poor experience that I shared here with the Wafels & Dinges truck at an event I shared my disappointment here. I was immediately contacted by one of the Wafel guys who told me they would send over a gift card. It took some time but I finally received it and I look forward to a warm, sweet, delicious waffel very soon!!

Best waffels ever. I had the liege wafel with 4 different toppings. The soft and chewiness is something I never had with a waffel before, and it was great. The speculoos spread topped everything off. Would definitely come back if I ever see the truck again.

What's there not to like about a great, fresh waffle from a truck?  The Belgian waffle with speckuloos (it really is liquid crack) and strawberries is my favorite combination.  At $6 for the two toppings, it is a little expensive but I think it's well worth it for a warm waffle on a cool fall day.  People at the truck are very friendly and like interacting with their customers (though I can't say the same about their Seaport cart spin-off). Only minor complaint I have are with the times they don't give me a fresh waffle and just reheat a pre-cooked one.  It's hit or miss sometimes but just know that you're not getting the full experience until you've had their fresh waffles.  I'm happy to say the Wafel & Dinges truck is one I will always visit if I see it around and I highly recommend you stop by if you see it too.On a sidenote, I love the jars of speckuloos they sell now.  They run about $7 for a 14 oz. jar (slightly smaller than a peanut butter jar).  Little pricey but once you try it, you won't be able to stop eating it.  Works best straight out of the jar or on some toast for breakfast.
Me and @donniewahlberg eat here. plixi.com/p/44405833Watch Blue Bloods on CBS this fall on Friday nights!

I stumbled upon this truck while on my way home after a movie. Wow what a wonderful surprise. I couldn't help myself and had to try one of their waffles. I had a waffle with strawberries and nutella and it was so good. I can't wait to go back and try the one with the bacon.
Love the BELGIAN WAFFLES! I love the crystalized sugar on the waffle and I only come here for De Throwdown waffle! SPEKULOOS and WAFFLES= DELISH!!!

You scream for nutella, we all scream for nutella!Who doesn't love this smooth, chocolate-y, hazelnut spread slathered on their waffle? YUM, I found this cart outside on Hudson St and was immediately drawn to the pictures of Belgian waffles dancing on the side of the truck. I got the "WMD waffle", which means for $7 you can put as many toppings as you want on it. I tried nutella, strawberries, bananas, whipped cream and chocolate sauce on my waffle and it was pure decadence! The waffle itself is about the size of a very thick slide of bread, I thought it was a little small for $7.. It's served in a cardboard container w/ an open side so that you can just hold up the box to your lips and eat it without a fork! (Kind of like pizza). The only reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is that I thought the portion was pretty tiny. But, still tastes great w/ coffee from the truck! Try it! :)

Pretty damn good.  I had the wafel with the Spekuloos ice cream, hot fudge and strawberry.  It was a huge portion and serving time was fast.  It was perfect for a warm NYC night.And the guy taught me how to pronounce dinges.  It's ding-ehs.  I was wrong all along.

Love, Love, Love this food cart. These wafles are amazing. Such a great treat to grab on the go. I love the Liege wafle with Spekuloos on top and a piping hot cup of Apple Cider. So worth it, if the truck is not in your neighborhood, venture out to find it. Worth the trek.
Great, flavorful waffles. Loved the Spekuloos ice cream! They were right- it DOES taste like teddy grahams. Get it with Nutella drizzled on the top.

Dangerously delicious...A Liege Wafel + Dinges (strawberry, Belgian Fudge, Spekuloos) = unbelievably delcious!The waffle was perfect in every way, soft inside, crispy on the outside. I was so craving another one after I finished the first. I'm sure I can easily eat 3 of these. But then I probably wouldn't feel well afterwards.

My favorite dessert place in town so far. So far I've kept it pretty simple -- a Dinge with a scoop of vanilla and bananas -- but it's absolutely incredible. The Dinge is dense and chewy, made with dough instead of batter. The ice cream, too, is very dense and delicious. Highly recommended!

Little did I know that there's a truck at South Street Seaport with no chasing to do! It's there everyday except for Monday and Tuesday. I live like 5 minutes away and have been wanting to try this place out for awhile.I finally got to go yesterday. There wasn't a long line which was nice, but these 3 people were standing like 8 feet back. I asked them if they were waiting in line (just to be courteous) and to my surprise, they said they were. Ok then. I'll wait. So wafel man is chatting up the current customers, probably thinking that these foolios in front of me are just trying to figure out what to get. Clearly, he's ready to take the next order and I'm getting sick of waiting. So, I'm ready to jump in front of these guys if they don't order soon. I give them some attitude, and I'm like, Are you guys going to order? And they start inching towards the truck.OMG. Really? 3 people order ONE hot chocolate. Did it really take you that long to figure that out? So you just wasted 5 minutes of my time. I want my damn wafel!  I got things to do, and places to be! Get out of my way you indecisive fools!So I finally get to order and the guy is really nice. I get a liege wafel with spekuloos. In the words of Rachel Ray, YUM-O!!It was a little windy yesterday and my hair is flying around, powdered sugar is all over my shirt, and spekuloos is dripping onto my folder and hands. I'm a hot mess but I don't care because my wafel is delicious and I'm thinking about what dinge to try next time.I'll definitely be hitting up this place like once a week....haha.

Just in:As of July 15, 2009 the Wafels and Dinges truck is now serving...wait for it...wait for it...Bacon & Syrup Waffles! You read that right, BACON! Good God almighty someone loves me up there! I must have done something right in my life to deserve such a thing. It's BAAAACON!!!
I ordered the Belgian cocoa, OMG it tasted good, a little to sweet but still good.

Rainy day at columbus circle, no line and the sunday churro special was still available on monday. Best day ever! Dulce de leche and cinnamon sugar..yum. Crazy guy walked by me while waiting for the train, I had to hold my wafel close.

Tasty. Flakey. GOODNESS.Skip the greasy diner next weekend, look it up and go to the truck!Well worth the journey. I've been a big fan of the big golden truck for quite a while. As I've repeatedly recommend it to friends, it seemed only right to write the review.Twitter.Facebook.Go... now!

So I'm walking the streets of New York and I see a line for this food truck and decide to stop by. This was the best thing ever! So delcious and their toppings are just as good as their waffles. I made a big mess but I didn't care. I was in heaven.

Oh. my. I am a waffle person and therefore sought out Wafels and Dinges. They had a booth at the Union Square fair going on this past Thanksgiving week. I had a liége wafel with nutella..mmmmmmmmm...Soft and chewy, hot and decadent, absolutely awe-inspiring. Worth my five bucks, and next time I'm getting nutella and strawberries to achieve absolute perfection.I dont know why I'm writing this review, because nothing can really be said. EAT IT.

I thought I paid a little too much money for what I ordered. I mean $7 for a small waffle with nutella, whipped cream and walnuts. I mean I can pay $5 or $6 for a crepe that comes with nutella, whipped cream and ice cream!

Short review... it's the real deal.  I've been to Belgium and had gaufres there that were not as good as these.  The people working at my truck were from Belgium, always a good sign.  I think the dipping sauces are interesting but superfluous, just my opinion.  Still, we got the Speckaloos because the guy told my daughter it was made out of unicorns, so how can you not get that???  Maybe we'll get some waffle trucks in Boston so I won't have to trek to the quite good Saus (reviewed here previously) everytime I want a waffle (and then feel compelled to eat the frites and frikandels as well).  Yum.

YES YES YES!!!I love this place. The spekuloos is awesome and I like to keep my 'wafel' pretty classic with strawberry, banana and some chocolate. Soooo good.The guys working this thing are always nice and helpful. I really like this place and hope they have more trucks around Manhattan soon.

Very very very good Liege waffels. I am a Belgian, so I know what I am talking about. In Belgium, we actually don't eat them with all the "dinges". The plain waffle on itself is already delicious enough... Our waffle was just perfect... Cooked enough, with enough molten sugar in it.... Mmmmmm, a real taste of home for us!

Belgian Waffles. What's not to love?!After I tried deThrowdown Wafel that they beat Bobby Flay with, I was hooked. The taste and texture of the waffle, the yummy spekuloos spread... *drool*. The size of the regular waffles are on the smaller side, but snack-size perfect for a foodie like me who finds joy in exploring NYC just for the food finds. My SO tried the pulled pork waffle, which was also quite good... and more filling.I like that they have a regular schedule, so the hunt for the truck is more predictable and easier to satisfy a craving (unlike ones in LA), but they're on twitter anyway. And the guys in the truck are friendly, seemingly enjoying their job (I'd love their job), which reflects in their delectables. I haven't found a "best" time to go. The line is hit or miss. I've gotten there mid-afternoon and there's a short line, but a few seconds later, the line was 10+ long with suited men and women fresh out of their offices with the same idea as me. Regardless, it's worth the wait, however long or short.

i don't know why this cart makes me so friggin' happy.when i get a hankerin' for it, I HAVE TO HUNT IT DOWN AND HAVE IT. BEST COMBO: warm chewy Liege wafle + spekuloos spread + strawberries + bananas + belgium fudge (hardens), fresh whipped cream + spekuloos ice cream (best part)!i love SPEKUUUULOOOOOS!!!! heavenly.
Always a fun and yummy experience!Even though I almost always get my wafel plain (as a true Belgian) all the toppings are great and the speculoos ice cream is the best!

Aw man.  Food this indulgent should be illegal.  i've heard the WMD compared to sex.  er, the cigarette smoked after eating a WMD was likened to the after-sex cigarette, which is kind of the same thing.  Wafel Truck can be found in park slope on the weekends and also on 52nd/6th Ave on certain weekdays.  This is bad news for my waistline.  Soft and chewy with strawberries and nutellalight and crunchy and covered in chocolateor even the choclate dipped waffle bowl filled with ice cream...the world will never be the same.
The absolute best waffles you can ever have.  It was so good, that we had to get a second one!  Next time we visit NY, I will eat it daily!

These waffles are to die for. Sweet and chewy with a hint of crunch on the outside, the liege waffle is one of the best desserts I've ever had. I like mine with strawberries and whipped cream. I haven't had the gingerbread spread yet but everyone at the truck today besides me ordered it. I saw a woman walk away after purchasing 3 jars of the stuff. Maybe it's highly addictive or something. Don't walk--run to this truck when you see it and enjoy waffles as they should be made.
I just tried this place for the first time this weekend and got the "throw down" waffle. I can't think of a better dessert that i have had in my life! AMAZING!!!

Revised on 3/16:The menu is definitely fun and appealing. They make some delicious dessert, and I want to stress dessert, waffles. Do not expect to be full on their pulled pork bbq waffle.  Plus bonus points for their fun twitter feed where every day they have some sort of activity or trivia for you to answer to get one free topping for your waffle.I am giving an additional star for customer service and to emphasize the fun menu. After my initial review, Thomas messaged me to get additional feedback on my experience. This was definitely surprising and I really appreciated it. Additionally, unlike most food trucks, they always have something unique on their menu if you want to try something new. For example, for St. Patty's Day weekend, their special is de Irish Coffee Wafel! They do lose points for trying to call my neighborhood "FoHi"... not cool at all!

The wafel was very good...it got a little chewy towards the end so you have to scarf it down (usually not a problem).  I ordered mine with nutella, spekuloos, and whipped cream.  I saw couples sharing theirs...but I managed to eat mine all by myself and loved it!

Pulled Pork on A Waffle ! Why didn't someone come up with this sooner. The waffles are really sweet. You can put almost anything on it ! I love Nutella on the waffles . They have locations in soho and columbus circle

I love their waffles!! Definitely something you can't miss. I like both Brussels wafel and liege wafel.In addition to great food, the worker was very nice and friendly.Will return when I have craving for waffles.

The first time I bit into a Liege waffle from the truck my whole body cried out in protest.  My stomach was afraid of how fat a weekly dose of this deliciousness would make me.  My brain worried about how late it was going to make me for work on Mondays.  My wallet (ok, not a body part but just go with it) worried about the extra expense.  My tastebuds couldn't handle the guilt, my... uh... I don't know... my calf muscle or something like that was displeased about the uh... potassium sodium balance?  Fine, I'm not creative enough to keep this going.  Wafel truck = HeavenYou = stupid for not eating at the wafel truckYes, I'm comfortable insulting anyone who reads about the wafel truck and then still passes by without eating there.Liege waffel + Speukloos + Bananas.  $6, maybe $1 for tip, always results in amazingness.  In conclusion, beware of the powdered sugar while wearing black.

I'm updating my original review (which was previously 3 stars based purely on price, NOT quality) because Thomas from Wafels & Dinges wrote me a very polite email explaining that it is a wee bit pricier due to the authentic ingredients imported from Belgium. Well, Thomas - you got me. Excellent point and all things considered, it deserves an excellent rating. Per my original review, the following statements still stand: These waffles are definitely delicious; crispy on the outside, warm and soft on the inside and the toppings are fresh...and the spekuloos might damn well be one of the best toppings out there period.

Try this place at least once. Its different from American style waffles you might find at a diner. It is more chewy and has small clumps of special sugar hidden inside the same way youd find choco chips in a cookie. This is one nice hot treat, and if youre lucky there wont be much of a line bc the wait can be torturous. They take a while to make so you can see em and smell em but you cant have em...yet. Not until they make yours.Sometimes the bottom can be really burnt tho from the sugar which isnt that appealing to me. I wouldnt be too greedy with the toppings unless you have a drink handy since it can really get stuck in your throat. Mmm. Choking on goodness. Its perplexing.

Ah... food trucks... how I've missed them so much. This was vacation so I allowed myself indulgences...Luckily, Wafels and Dinges did not disappoint for the only food truck I hit up in NYC! Little nephew had a mini waffle while the gf and I had a belgian waffle with bananas and the gingerbread spread. Nephew devoured his and all that was left was a little boy that looked like a Coke addict with all the powdered sugar on his face. The hyperactivity that ensued after wolfing down his waffle also added to the effect!Gf and I were slightly better, but ours was finished very quickly too! Between a four and a five in my book!

Very yummy, and super sweet toppings.  When you want to indulge, this is the perfect escape.  I played it safe with their topping and du leche, but not on top of each other -  way toooooo sweet.  Definitely worth the money and it isn't even expensive!
I love wafels & dinges. I mean I really LOVE wafels and dinges. Liege Waffle with Nutela and Strawberries, that's all I'll ever need to be truly happy. The End.

Consistently awesome customer service is why I LOVE this place! Had a waffle today before heading to class and while it was very delicious, the customer service really made a strong impression on me. The employees were very friendly and seemed happy to take my order. Wrote my name on the box while the waffle was cooking and called me by my name the entire time. The Wafels & Dinges team had a great system for moving the customers along in a quick and efficient manner and I saw tons of happy and satisfied customers today. By far, this is one of my favorite food trucks in the city and I will definitely return some time soon and will make sure that I bring friends to enjoy the heavenly waffle experience as well :)

Oh my goodness this may have been the best dessert that I tried in Manhattan, the texture of the waffle was perfect, slightly crispy on the outside, soft and dense but fluffy on the inside, paired with the speculoos (sp?) gingerbread ice cream and Nutella. It was so rich but I still downed it. So good that while discussing it's beauty with my brother he stated that although he does not like sweets, and even though he'd just eaten a huge dinner and had absolutely no room for anything, he would still eat this afterwards every time. Trying not to think about the fact that it will be a few months until I can taste one again.

Quite unfortunate. I love their waffles and often stop by this booth (this one is a semi-permanent booth than a truck) on the way to/from work. However, after today I am not sure if I will continue. Since I am a frequent visitor I know they close at 10 pm. I made sure to leave work by 9:30 pm so I can have a fix on my way home in time. I arrived at 9:35 pm and found them closing up, much to my unpleasant surprise and dismay. The server brusquely informed me that they were closed. When I said "but you are open till 10 pm..." she replied, again in a rather terse manner, "my BOSS told me to close!!! It was raining, there was no money coming in!" I was speechless. What's the point of publishing hours if you are not going to keep it?! I should also mention that she did not apologize once- "I am sorry, please come back next time and I will make sure to give you extra toppings for your inconvenience!" OK, I wouldn't expect that because that would be great customer service. Simple "I am sorry" would suffice. But no, it's not-my-fault-my-boss-made-me-do-it. I get it. It's the end of the day. You wanna clean up and go home. But I worked too, and I went out of the way and made sure to leave on time to come here so I can reward myself with a delicious waffel as I often do. But not anymore.

BEST. WAFELS. EVER. Cant get enough of the Spekuloos spread! Always buy 5 to bring back home (Miami) with me! Ordered the Spekuloos spread with Spekuloos Ice cream and its absolutely AMAZING! :) LOVE YOU GUYS!

OMG. I think I dream about these waffles. You have to get the fresh ones but they are amazing. The spekulous spread is soooo good. I have been known to buy the container and eat it with a spoon. These guys really know how to make a waffle. Also, during the summer (for all of a week) they made waffle cones that were double thick with speculous spread in the middle. These cones were crumbly, sweet, yummy, amazing. I can no longer eat a regular waffle cone because these were so much better than anything other cone I have ever had.

Dear Wafels and Dinges,Please open a store front. Your waffles are amazing and  I am tired of chasing you around the city. Every time I have wanted to try you, you are not there. That is every time until today! Tried the Liege waffle with strawberries, thank you it was delicious. Soft chewy but with just enough crisp. No need for syrup, no need for butter. I just wish they were larger!!!Now I will just have to track you down again and try the Brussels...

If you're in NYC then go get the dethrowdownwafel now!  You will not be disappointed.  This is a a light, daytime snack of wafel, spekuloos spread (lighter in flavor than nutella or chocolate sauce) and whipped cream.  I wish they had a stand in the Bay Area, but I hear its opening in LA soon.They have a stand at Mad Square Market through Oct.23rd.    I also had the pleasure of meeting the throwdown winner himself, Thomas DeGeest.

Wow. I love waffles. I always felt waffles could kick the shit out of pancakes. But after trying the krispy, yet fluffy and perfectly prepared bacon waffles with butter and maple syrup from this pimped out giant wafflemaker, I can promise you pancakes are only for kids who like to land drop kicks and bite.

Saw this on Bobby Flay's Throwdown, and had to try it.  Walked with the dog for an hour across town to get here.  Worth the trip!! nom nom nomThe guys were really friendly, and I did my penguin imitation for free dinges (woohoo!).  I got the liege wafel with spekuloos and walnuts.  WINNING COMBINATION!  I would recommend it. (spekuloos was described to me as Belgium peanut butter with a hint of gingerbread flavor)I like that this cart is small, and the menu feels authentic (c'mon...they spell it wafels and dinges, but they really mean waffles and toppings!), and the guys have an accent (must be authentic from Belgium??)

So good!  Not a typical waffle, slightly chewey, as described on the menu.  The Speculoos spread was delicious too.  The only improvement I could suggest is for the vendor to ask if you want the powdered sugar on top.  It was messy!

I aboslutely love the Waffles here.  I pass by here all the time but I never bothered to stop for a waffle.  Finally I decided to give it a shot and OMG...I couldn't believe how good it was.  The ice cream on waffles is simply AMAZING and mouth-watering.  This place is pure bliss when they cover it with strawberries and Nutella (my favorite combo).

On Tuesdays they are on 52nd b/w Lex and 3rd.  It's a funny coincidence that all of my lunch meetings have been rescheduled to Wednesdays.  There is usually a line, but it goes pretty quickly.  My favorite order is the brussels wafel with WMD! (Wafel of Massive Deliciousness)  which means you can choose from several fantastic toppings, nutella, spekulous, dulce de leche, etc. You can also follow them on twitter to see their locations on other days, which is great for when you are exploring the city and suffer from a wafel withdrawal.

I was walking through Central Park in January, and at the end of the trail, at the edge of the park.. i saw this wafels cart. I was visiting the city and had heard of Wafles and Dinges but figured i wouldnt get the chance to try it since I heard it travels around the town. Taking advantage of this good fortune, I got a wafel with strawberries and vanilla ice cream (simple is best in my opinion) Texture was perfect. Crisp on the outside, and warm and moist on the inside. Portion was adequate and the box it came in made eating on the go convenient. It wasn't overly sweet which was perfect for me.  I dont even like dessert but this was pretty awesome.
AMAZING. Nutella bananas and strawberries.. just sayingMust go in NY

Ate here two nights back to back.  First time with one of my bestfriend and another with my beau. Two different experiences... First time: My friends and I just finished a meal at May's Sushi and wanted to get out of the place and look for a place for dessert.  I went on Twitter to check if any of the sweet foods trucks were around and saw that Wafels and Dinges Truck was by Union Sq.  So we paid our bill and started walking to the location.  My friends spotted out the school bus yellow truck before I did.   There was a small crowd when we arrived but the wait was not long at all Dining Time: 9pmReason for Dining: Wanted a new and quick served dessert Service: 3 guys working in the truck. They were nice and was able to answer our questions like "what are dinges" and what's their special spread "spekuloos spread" was... Food:  One of my friends and I chose BRUSSELS WAFEL, 1 scoop of RASPBERRY VANILLA ICECREAM and NUTELLA, which drizzled all across the top. I thought the wafel wouldn't be that great since the guy just picked a pre-made one and put it on one of the many wafel makers to warm it up but was I wrong!  The wafel was airy and light and just melted in my mouth when I took a bite.  The ice-cream was just ice-cream and  nutella is as fabulous as chocolate fudge on a sundae.  GREAT COMBO!  NOTE: my friend would've ate all of it but she recalled that she was SHARING with me and stopped inhaling it 1/2 way through. If she didn't share with me, she would've finished the whole thing by the time it takes to walk one NY street blockSecond time: Although my beau and I were full from a dinner at Gyu Kaku, we were still in search for dessert.  We would've eaten dessert at the restaurant but they ran out of the famous Green Tea crepes so that's that.   I quickly searched on Twitter and there it goes the truck nearly 2 blocks away from Gyu.Dining Time: 1am Reason for Dining: Search for dessert Service: Wafel and Dinges offers a free dinges if you do what they say on their daily Tweet. Today, you get a free dinges if you give an evil eye. My beau did it but we still had to end up paying $1 bc we chose ice cream as one of our dinges which costs $2 for a scoop so technically we didn't get that for free but got 50% off.  The guys working at this truck weren't as flirtatious as the ones from the previous location but he was still nice.  Food: LIEGE WAFEL, SPEKULOOS SPREAD, and scoop of VANILLA ICE CREAM. They sprinkled powdered sugar on top.   I'm not really a fan of this kind wafel. A bit thick and chewy for me for a dessert. This would be a good breakfast wafel though.  RECOMMEND THE SPREAD- it's a cross between a nut butter with graham crakers OVERALL - Choose the Brussel if you want something light and sweet , great option for a light sweet dessert! If you're looking for something a bit more substantial to be a meal, I recommend Leige Wafel - top it with the spread and maybe some fruit and you'll have meal! This is a great way to eat one of the famous "breakfast" food without waiting for weekend brunch or heading to iHOP.

* Make sure you check out twitter before coming to the truck. You come to know the special promotions, the location of truck etc.. This waffle truck wonderfully makes the best use of social media.* for just 5 bucks, you can enjoy a delicious Belgian waffle with toppings like bananas, strawberry, nutella etc...* The guys working at the truck are really warm and welcoming.

Oh how good it is. I finally found this treasure on my way home one weekend afternoon and boy can I say it was delicious. I ordered the Liege waffle with bananas. The waffle crust was just perfect and the fresh bananas just added to the flavors. I would have given them a five star review if only they had a store front. If I get lucky enough to stumble across this truck again I will be sure to try the ice cream and waffle combos as it looked delicious on a warm afternoon.

Nothing starts your morning on the right foot more than a hot, succulent fresh waffle from this truck. I always get the liege waffle, and it's the perfect texture and taste - crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside. I've tried to find a recipe and make it for myself at home, but to no avail. I will continue to be a faithful customer!

Oh, "Wafel and Dinges" how I love thee. I wasn't too impressed the first time I tried you (I was reheated a waffle), but right off the griddle- bacon filled or your liege, I cannot beat you. I am weaken by your flavor. Mmm... bacon filled waffle. Liege, how did you get caramel inside you? Oh, that's just how you taste. And speekulos. How can I forget when we first met? It was only a month ago. It's just a matter of time before America catches on to your greatness and I will be glad to know that I was one of the first to line up for you. How do you manage to make everything taste so good? Speekulos ice cream? Genius.

If I didn't promise myself this year to cut back on sweets, I would eat this every week.  The first time I their waffle was December last year at Bryant park.  They had a pop up store on the corner that faced sixth avenue.  The woman behind the counter warmed up the waffle for me and added whipped cream and Nutella.  The combination of the Nutella, whipped cream and the warm crispy waffle injected with caramelized sugar was unbelievably good.

Wandered out of the apartment aimlessly on a sunday morning seeking brunch. Lo and behold , I stumble upon a wafels and Dinges truck parked right in my middle of my neighborhood. Immediate change of plans. While I have passed the trucks in Manhattan many times before, I never tried it. I had the bacon and syrup waffle. I expected it to be good, but not this good. The bacon was actually cooked into the batter of the waffle and it was topped with the perfect amount of syrup. Perfect salty\sweet combo.Only 6 bucks, definitely worth it. The people working the truck were very cheery and pleasant. I hope they are here to stay!I will be visiting again for sure. Excited to try their savory selections!

A delicious (though not the healthiest) way to kick off lunch. But who can resist a warm Belgian waffle with a crispy exterior and chewy interior smothered in dark chocolate, strawberries, and powdered sugar? Easily one of the best waffles I have ever had. Thank you, Wafels & Dinges. Manic Mondays will never be the same.  [And thank you, Daniel H. for introducing me to W & D.] [UWSers, here's their Monday schedule: 8am - 5pm: Broadway between 113th and 114th Street (at Columbia University); 6pm - 10pm: Broadway and 62nd Street (near Movie Theater).]

FOOD: Got the Waffle that beat Bobby Flay's Throwdown. It had the speculoos (not from a nut) and it was AWESOME! It was sweet and nutty. The waffle itself was thick, crispy and crunchy. It's unlike any waffle I've ever had. I barely had enough room to try my friend's waffle. My friend got a waffle with bananas, cream and chocolate syrup. That was amazing too. The banana slices were fresh and the cream on it was decadent and sweet. TESTIMONY: I hate waffles. Unless they are eggos from when I was a kid. The rest have been terrible. Even the eggos are bad, but they bring nostalgia to the table. I remember walking to the truck and being irritated with everything. After the waffle, I had a smile on my face that I couldn't get off. Too bad the truck is not in my area everyday. The food is top notch, the people are friendly, and the best part is - they park in front of Flay's Restaurant on Friday.

Um. Thanks a lot Food Network for getting me to crave these wafels since the first time the special aired! I FINALLY got my fix yesterday at the Astor Place location and SO. WORTH. IT.I actually didn't want any dinges on my wafel -- needed to taste the flavor of it all on its own! I had a Liege wafel and NOM folks. NOM. It was slightly sweet where the pearl sugar melted, warm and chewy. Dangerous to have it so easily accessible!
i really like their waffles with some coffee but i cant have more than a mini. The spekuloos is very sweet so dont go crazy with it.

party in my mouth! Stopped by the truck after eating dinner in the area, since I had heard about it for ages and always wanted to give it a try. I was with two other friends that hadn't tried the truck before either and we decided to split one brussels wafel and one liege wafel between us so we could try them both! On our brussels wafel (the crunchier one) we got practically every topping there was (strawberries, bananas, whipped cream, nutella, dulce de leche, and spekuloos) since it's only $2 for unlimited toppings so you might as well! Our expert friend who accompanied us and who has come here so often that the workers recognize him, described the spekuloos as tasting like teddy grahams...and the comparison was spot-on! On our liege wafel we took a simpler route and only got ice cream and chocolate fudge on it. It's hard to say which wafel I liked more! I say you really gotta try them both =P

Ok. I want to start of by saying i loooove the "waffle truck" so much that when I get off of work in the evening I run to the 'Vedette' cart on 60th Street. Now my gripe... The Waffle Dude shuts this cart down any time he wants. And I mean any time. It says that it shuts down at 7:59. I've seen him leaving atleast a 1/2hr earlier than that and I know sometimes he leaves earlier. Finally, I told my friend that I had to Yelp this truck! If this was a brick & mortar store he wouldnt be able to shut down at whim. It sucks. I know some trucks that will stay later knowing there are people that are still willing to come. I actually told Waffle Dude one time that I'd be back and he told me he was packing up. It was 7:15. He was gone by 7:30pm. WTF?

I am going to be honest, I am not a waffle person and I hate the consistency of syrup, so this was definitely not my choice BUT my bf has wanted to try this for awhile and I get to make it more of a dessert! YAY SWEETS! The guys were funny, friendly and so helpful! My bf ended up getting the pulled pork waffle bc he read reviews and heard it was great (Also, the guy who helped us kind of egged him on) I know it sounds weird but it was actually quite tasty! I ordered my own concoction of spekuloos-crushed gingerbread cookie spread, strawberries, whipped cream, with a drizzle of chocolate! DELICIOUS but definitely will ruin that diet! All in all, definitely a must try before you die! YUMMM

I found Wafels & Dinges in Madison Square Park at night. The lady served liege wafel was friendly. It was very cold, so I couldn't enjoy waffle much. Hence, I decided to try Wafels & Dinges another day.They moves around Manhattan by truck. I checked their schedule and finally got a chance to try it again. It was warm day. And as you can see, my rating is 3 stars. The guys served waffle were nice. The decoration on waffle was awful. It didn't look tasty to me. Taste was just OK, and I think it's overpriced waffle.

As if this business needed another 5 star review.I discovered Wafels and Dinges while walking through Central Park. The cart was cute and the people working at it seemed really friendly, so I decided to check it out. I ordered De Throwdown, which has been my wafel of choice ever since. Depending on how freshly made the wafels are, it ranges from good to OMGWOWYUMMMMMM! (usually the latter). Wafels and Dinges makes all other wafels just look sad and pathetic.
