Their waffles are apt for eating any time of the day and if you have a smaller appetite, go for the mini ones. They even have a black board to write your comments on.

Everyone loves Wafels and Dinges, but I think the clear winner in the waffle wars is Le Petite Belge.  The waffle I had at Wafles and Dinges was pre-mdae (a definite no-no because it made the waffle really soggy by the time I got it in my hands) and the toppings were out of a can, which made the waffle EVEN MORE SOGGY.  Waffles should NOT be soggy, they should be crispy and delicious.  They have one saving grace: you can get as many toppings as you want for a couple of extra dollars (unlike Le Petite Belge where you have to buy each topping separately).
Oh my gush! Stay away if you don't want to get addicted and gain like 10 lbs. SOOO GOOD. Hope I don't bump into them again!

This is a damn good waffle.  Hard to get too excited over it, but I can appreciate something when it is done to perfection. The belgian-style waffle I had was just about as good as what you can get in Europe.  I give the place overall 4 stars because the liege waffle was not nearly as good.  (5+3 averages to 4)  Reason the belgian was so tasty was probably that they had to make it fresh - I had to wait a good 5 min for it but definitely worth it.

I had great expectations thanks to Bobby Flay! I have to say, I love baked goods, pastries, desserts etc but I was mildly disappointed perhaps not because the wafel wasn't tasty (trust me it was!) but perhaps because I felt that $6 for a wafel with two toppings is a little steep. The wafel was warm and crunchy, but nothing spectacular. Nutella, in my opinion, wasn't a good idea for a topping either... All in all, if the truck is in your neighborhood and you're craving for a warm dessert, go for it. I wouldn't go searching for it though....

classy.  the search for these trucks/carts is the best. even though they post all their spots, its fun to venture out to them.best waffle ive had, the speculoos spread is like crack, yes i'm addicted to crack as a recreational drug and i can form coherant sentences.

Honestly, I don't understand all the hype this food truck gets. It's really not all so good especially after I feel like I have been robbed for 8 dollars per waffle. It's really just a typical waffle that you can smear some nutella, put strawberries on your own, and put some other sweet toppings on. It's really not worth the money.

Waffles for lunch?  Yes please.  I prefer the play on the Southern favorite, Waffles and Pulled pork.  Saltiness and sweetness come together for a blissful meal.  The desert waffles are also a great pick-me up in the middle of a Mid-Town day (at least whenever it is around).Make sure you either have somewhere to go to eat them, or be extremely talented at walking, eating and not making a mess!
The best waffles ever! I had never had speculoos spread before I tried a waffle from this truck and I am a fan.

if i needed to choose the last thing to eat on this fine earth i would totally pick "da flay". i mean it's kind of shockingly delicious. also so sad to hear about people's bad experiences with the staff...i had two different set of wafel fellas and they have all been super sweet and helpful and patient annnnnd then made me the best thing i ever ate to boot :Dthanks waffel truck! i'm now stalking you!
Was in New York for few days.Visited central park at least  thrice just to eat waffle here, couldn't resist it at all. Eat any waffle you won't be disappointed.
What is better than a waffle smothered in Speculoos? Nothing. Love this food truck...you can't go wrong.

I wanted Wafels and Dinges for months.  When I heard about the Prospect Park Food Truck Rally every third Sunday of the month, I marched myself up there with gusto.  IT IS AMAZING.  The most amazing deliciousness you might ever put in your mouth.  You really want some Wafels and Dinges.  Follow them on twitter @waffletruck for locations and ways to get free stuff and clever contests.  Love them.

There are very few foods that I will travel great distances for.  Fried Dumplings from Fried Dumpling?  yes.  LaRosa's pizza?  yes.  Good Indian?  yes.Belgian waffles with sugar bits that melt and fill you with fructose goodness?  YES HELL YESI love love love this stuff.  LOVE.  I pay far too much money for it.  Because I love it.  Really, I can't be coherent or witty, I am full of love.When I discovered that this cart hangs out around the Christoper street 1 station Friday and Saturday nights, I made a point of coming down.  I live on 200th street, people, and I trekked my ass all the way down the nearly 200 blocks just to have this tasty treat.YMMV, but me?  Love. This. Stuff.YUM.

I HEART wafels!  I don't even recall when I experienced my first Wafel from the Wafels and Dinges truck, but I do recall that I loved every bite of the wafel and every moment of the experience.  I can't pass by one of their trucks or carts without stopping for a wafel, no matter how much I may have eaten immediately prior.  I always get the Spekuloos spread, and sometimes add Nutella to the mix if I'm feeling brave enough to participate in the "challenge of the day" for a free topping.  Some treats or meals are a 'sharing' treat/meal, but this one is not.  I want this all to myself.  In addition, the trucks are run by some seriously, genuinely, nice, nice peeps.

Wafels & Dinges is the absolute bomb!!! Every time I go to NYC to visit my family, I have to get my wafel fix or else my trip is not complete. I just wish they would open a location in Washington DC - that way I can have my wafel of massive deliciousness more than once a month!

Had the "Throwdown wafel": liege wafel with spekuloos spread and whipped cream.  I don't remember what Bobby Flay's waffle was in the challenge, but the W&D wafel was fantastic!  Definitely worth going off the diet.  Probably the best dessert I've had in months from any restaurant.  The truck folks placed it in a very sturdy box that made it to my apartment with no damage (OK, I live 2 blocks away so I didn't have to go too far).  Yummy, yummy and yummy!

I am a fan of waffles, but this one takes the cake! It just melts in your mouth and I wanted to try one with each different topping!! They also told me that they beat Bobby Flay in a Waffle "Thowdown" (Food Network show) so that says it all! Not many people beat Bobby Flay! Worth waiting in line for.

Wow was I excited today when I was walking to the office and saw the yellow truck on the corner of 23rd and 5th.  I had read about the Wafels & Dinges truck and its owner, Thomas, a number of months ago, and knew that if ever they came to my neighborhood, or if I passed the truck in my travels that I had to stop and treat myself (not like treating myself is a rare occurance, so I just consider this adding to my list of treats).So I stopped here on the way into the office and treated myself with a "Liege Wafel" with strawberries and whipped cream.  I HIGHLY recommend it.  Tasty, chewy, warm and delicious are my adjectives for it -- with just a slight crunch when biting into the sugary bits hidden inside this wonderful treat.  I can only imagine they are better only if standing in on the streets in Brussels while soaking in the atmosphere.The biggest challenge is trying to keep up with where the truck will be from day-to-day.  Although Thomas is probably doing a lot of people a BIG favor by not staying in one place too long . . . the calories are a dangerous thing.
Love LOVE love the wafels here, if you can catch the truck, GREAT, or catch them @ the Jersey shore (seaside) when its open, best damn wafels ever!

Their waffles are as good as they get for avg 6 bucks. I ordered the liege waffle ( cinnamon flavor) with the speckuloos spread and strawberries.  first bite i ever had sent me up to the heavens. Red bull dont give you wings... these waffles do baby.  The spread was one of a kind bc they are graham cracker flavor BUT  with the texture of peanut butter.. trippy. Because the spread is a bit  sticky, a second fruit dinges ( topping) is highly recommended.  It is SO GOOD And the fact that is so affordable makes it a must try!
I got the WMD and went all in.  The toppings were fresh and the wafle was just right.  It's perfection

I was partly raised in Belgium and I have a mild obsession with Liege waffles (the "other kind" of Belgium waffle that is sweeter and chewier).  These folks nailed it, in my opinion.  They have the right fragrance, mouth feel and taste that I so often miss and can so rarely find in this country.  Thank you, thank you.  Cannot wait to try more.  They also seem very fun and organized.

Ehhhhhhh .... I wanted to love it, but have to say, the Waffle Mania truck in San Francisco is better.  Not sure how that is possible, but it is.  Definitely recommend checking it out though if you even remotely love waffles.

oh haiiiii wafelssssss-oh haiiii awes guy hoo werks derr! oh haiiii choca covered strawsberrrriesssoh haiii my favorite bird/movie/tv show/dog/food is...oh nooo I have to go homeeeeoh haiii dream bout my next wafel experienceee

The waffle was amazing. I forget which one I had. It was the one that was in some competition on some TV show. Whatever it was it was good. My only wish is that the waffle was a little bigger BUT it is probably good that it wasn't. I don't need to extra calories.

What an excellent recommendation by my brother!  I'm a huge fan of good food trucks, and this one sure didn't disappoint.  Nice and golden toast waffles with fresh toppings.  You can't really go wrong with strawberries and nutella.  It is a little pricey, but it was delicious!  Next time I'm gonna have to try this Spekuloos topping everyone speaks of.

Delicious! I recommend piling on as many toppings as possible. They routinely name waffles after me. The pulled pork waffle is just such an amazing treat in the winter and whoever came up with that idea, is my foodie hero. They now have a location in central park, near the turtle pond. Oh how I wish they would come to Boerum Hill!

This truck is awesome. Spekuloos on a fresh warm waffle! If you are craving a sweet snack on the go keep an eye out for this yellow truck! Seemed to be at a lot of the touristy places in NY (ie museums)

Featured on an episode of  Throwdown with Bobby Flay. Spotted this wafel stand at Central Park and was excited to try. I ordered a basic wafel with peanut butter and powdered sugar. The wafel itself was tasty and just the right amount of sweetness, although it is a bit denser than a traditional Belgian waffle I had before, but nevertheless, tasted good. Great to have one during a nice stroll in the park.

let me pitch a concept to you: a fresh waffle with all kinds of awesome stuff piled on top that you shove in your fat face on a sidewalk...dig it? greenlight that shit!i had the liege waffle with whipped cream, spekulous  (a sweet hazlenutty spread) and strawberries. and while it was phenomenal i should have had the waffle with......BACON INSIDE OF IT!!INSIDE!!!!!track this truck down...now!
The waffles are great, but I am absolutely obsessed with the spekuloos! I eat that stuff out of a jar (stop judging!), it's that good.
Liege wafel with strawberries, bananas, nutella and spekuloos. That's really all that needs to be said!

This is one of the best dessert trucks to try out in NYC. Been here 3 times and every time never ended short of amazing. I always ordered waffles topped with speukaloos spread and dulce de leche. The first bite is orgasmic and definitely put a smile of my face. Even if you are full from a previous meal, order the mini waffle. Its a good quick bite and dessert snack and only $3.  If you ever pass by this truck, definitely make a quick stop here.

I love wafles & dinges! I follow their truck on Twitter to track them down! Sometimes they offer one free dinge (topping) if you can play the guessing game and answer correctly! I love my wafel with chocolate syrup and whipped cream!

Had my first chicken and waffle ever from this booth in Bryant Park. It was like a chicken pot pie filling between two crispy herby waffles. If all chicken and waffles taste like this I think I'm hooked (I don't think they do). Super friendly staff, but don't go if you're in a hurry. They like to talk and we were trying to make out train home. I also tried the leige waffle with the gingerbread spread (they have a special name for this but I forget what it is) and belgium chocolate. I thought it was good, but I think Saus in Boston makes a better sweet waffle.

Yummers! I stopped by this truck after watching a film at the Lincoln Center Cinema, out of pure curiosity. The staff were really patient and friendly, they walked me through what dinges were, what the different waffles were, and helped me make a choice. Even if there were two people behind me in line, they didn't rush me or anything, which was really nice. I got the spekuloos on their recommendation, even though I was unsure since I tend not to like gingerbread, but it was really delicious! I only purchased the mini-wafel (oh how I like spelling "waffle" this way!) and I totally regret doing that, because for a mere 2 bucks more I could have enjoyed sooooo much more deliciousness. They make the waffles fresh, btw! For people who like warm desserts, this is definitely a truck to watch out for. It's bright yellow and awesome.
I had the Brussels Waffles topped with maple syrup, which were light and crispy.  It was named top nation wide food truck on the food network.   It was good and very eggy.  A great little snack.
My favorite food truck! Mouthwatering waffles - get yours with spekulos!

You can see me visit this place atleast once a week. they usually make me dance for a free ding... but that yummy crispy moist waffle is worth every second of humiliation.... no seriously its that good... i want that recipe dinges guys...

A tasty treat and one of NYC's best street eats. I dig the regular "Brussels" style with whipped cream and strawberries and powdered sugar.The Brussels will set you back $4, plus $1 each for whipped cream and strawberries.Yum-tastic.
I tried the De Throwdown Waffle and it was amazing. I waited in a long line to get this waffle and it was worth it.

Having heard soooo much about this place, er truck, I decided to stop by last Friday morning to chase away the cold with a "Liege" waffle.  I ponied up my $4 (+$2 for coffee) only to receive a 3' x 5" piece of waffle-like pastry.  I didn't know whether to frame it or eat it.  I think $4 is a bit much for what's on offer, but I suppose overhead is high when your restaurant is in a VAN DOWN BY THE RIV^H^H^HSouth Park Ave.I believe this is what they call in Belgium "det rippen-off".

Best liege waffles I've had in the city! Nothing comes even close. Make sure to get yours with spekuloos, bananas and whipped cream. An extra scoop of ice cream isn't a horrible idea either. If you crave them on a regular basis like I do, Arcadia (arcadianyc.com) in Chelsea sells them packaged in their store (as well as jars of spekuloos and brussels waffle mix)- and yes, they're practically as good as getting them off the truck, as long as you heat it in the oven first. You can order them online as well for delivery or pick-up.
Overpriced waffles that taste good but not for how much they want.

Oh boy. Never thought I would update a review from 1 to 5 stars, but here I am...so I never actually tasted this product as you can see...today I was treated to waffles from here and was damn impressed. There is a soft waffle you can have that carries a strong vanilla flavor. Then there is a waffle that is a bit crunchy because the edges have been carmelized somehow and it is sugary-sweet. Each waffle is $5 and nice tasting on their own, or with a bit of powdered sugar that is free. Or, you can choose to have toppings; each topping is a $1 and two or three toppings is $2. Being the pig that I am, I chose each type of waffle with three toppings. The strawberries really add balance to the waffle, as they are freshly cut and high quality. The hazelnut spread is nice. The belgian dark chocolate spread overpowers the waffle, but it is delicious. The dulce de leche is light and very sweet, for sugar addicts (hello!), this can make you close your eyes. The spekuloos spread is interesting, very graham cracker-y and unique really. Personally I would not choose for a waffle more than two toppings, as it just morphs the waffle into this piece of pastry that is holding your toppings and the waffle flavor itself gets lost. I would go for strawberries and one other at most. Now as to value; it is worth it (YES, I will actually PAY for this in the future), just because the waffles on their own are quite good (although the soft waffle can be a bit dry). I still think that selling the little sized pieces of waffle for $3 each are a complete waste of time and money for the customer, half that price would be worth it value wise to get a sense of what you could buy for $5, but perhaps not for the owners of this business. I found it insulting as a passerby initially, but maybe I'm too sensitive (or, simply, not "right in the head"). For first-timers, I would pay the $5, $6 or $7 on a full sized waffle to get the true experience and not give the $3 sibling a second thought.

Spekuloos is so good. I'd give you a 5 start but too bad there was an a$$ hole male server named phillip or something near the 81st central park place. I wanted to buy a jar of the spread and I pointed to it and maybe said it was spunkeloos. The a$$ thinking he is funny takes a jar and goes hey let say this out phonetically. I wanted to say hey dumba$$ I'm way smarter than you and this is the first time I got the jar of spread. I don't care if I call it the brown goop. The customer is always right as long as I can pay for it.  I hope the management reads this because that guy is in prime tourist and nyorker location and a rude server is always a bad thing. If you are reading this and get fired. Yay ill have to pay for another idiot on welfare. I hope the company hires better people next time. Oh yeah he was working today on 6/26/2011 around 4-5 pm with a female workmate.

Visiting from California and my 9 year old was hungry. Now we have lots of Beligum Waffel trucks up at the Tahoe ski resorts so I thought I knew what we were getting, but I was wrong. The Wafels & Dinges waffels were something altogther different!  I couldn't believe how light and crispy they were and the absolute best part - bar none - was the spekuloos spread.  The adorable young man who was running the cart recommended it for my son and we both ended up fighting over the last bite.  That afternoon we had to go back and buy a jar of the spekuloos spread.  I can't even describe it!  We're not eating it a home spead on vanilla wafers. I know I'm going to have to order it online when this jar runs out.  We are hooked!

My husband  and I love this truck. My husband is not so much of a sweets or dessert person, but since this truck makes waffles, he loves it.Our friend introduced this food truck to us and always crave for it when we are in the city.  Let's just say we go out of our way to have their food whenever I am in the city.You have to try their specula ( I don't know if that is how it's spelled) with their special ice cream.  It's better than Nutella.  You know why it's better than Nutella because it can only be found in one place...the waffle truck.Funny story:  Just this weekend, my husband and I went for a bike ride along the Westside Highway, where we started from our house in Staten Island.  We just passed the 59th St marker and was under the Westside Highway and I could see the Trump Plaza.  So we have gone very far already, if you are familiar with the city and SI.  I was running out of energy and getting cranky.  Until I saw the waffle truck and I halted and made a u turn immediately.  I needed some energy and sugar rush to get me through this journey.  My husband would usually be mad for me stopping the way I did, but he was all for it and was on line before I said anything.  Boy, was the bike ride worth it after having some waffles and ice cream.  There are several trucks around the city, but you need to go on their website to find them.  They are worth every penny and time to look for them.  There is nothing like this around.  What makes it more enticing is that the adults are the one who are eating this and not the children.  It's always fun to eat with strangers and talk about how awesome the food is.

i went here for breakfast one day. i went to the stand at the end of central park. the guy serving the food was hilarious and actually a really cool dude.  the food was absolutely delicious. i had the throw down which i think is my favorite by far. he even put on some strawberries for me! i'm going to continue to go back here. best waffles ever.

Just wanted to point out that the next time I was in the city I tracked down the cart again and it was just as tasty the second time except that this time I tried the speculoos spread and omg...there are no words for the deliciousness. I paired my waffle with a belgium hot chocolate which was hands down the best hot chocolate I ever had. Oh yeah, and did I forget to mention how funny and sweet the woman and man who worked at the cart were? It's so rare these days to nice vendors in NYC. Thanks again!
I've become somewhat obsessed with this place and try to talk everyone into going.  Its hands down my favorite place in the city, wherever they are.

was strolling around south street seaport and rather than get a regular mr. softee i thought i'd get my nephew something gourmet.  eeeh, i should've stuck with mr. softee.  the wafers were stale and nothing to write home about.for $5, it's okay to try once but i know i won't be trying again...

Follow your nose to this cart. These waffels taste as good as they smell.I'm going to have to say that might have been the best waffle I've ever had, I'm now wondering if all my life I've just had pale resemblances of waffles and maybe I've just tasted a real waffle? Is this THE waffle of waffles? Well the Lieges...let me tell you HOLY CRACK, seriously, filled with pearls of crack, I mean sugar (same diff in my world). I coulda eaten it plain, but fine, twist my arm and give me strawberries and whipped cream why don't you. More sugar on top? A nice powder drift?Yes, get me high!
De-lish!  Staff is so nice, they have funny messages on the hotline.  I had the cornbread waffle w/chili, yeehaw!  I thought we had good chili and cornbread in TX!

We purchased the deals from Living Social, for sweet and savory waffles, and for the picnic packs (8 waffles, 4 of which are chocolate, and jar of spekuloos).  YUM!!  I love the sweet waffles, and the picnic deal.  I took off one star for the savory.  We tried the bacon and pulled pork and didn't think either was particularly delicious.  But the sweet waffles are amazing.  I am loving the picnic packs.  I put a waffle in the toaster, spread in with spekuloos and banana.  What a lovely way to start the day!  I like the added crunch of the sugar crystals.

Having traveled in Belgium and had the "real thing" there, these wafels are authentic stateside wafels.  Thomas who mans the truck is very friendly and a great wafel maker.  Their batter for the regular brussels type of wafel is perfect, making a light and crispy treat.  The true meaning of wafel does not lie in your toaster with a name such as Eggo.  No, the beauty of a proper wafel can be experienced at this truck.  I dropped a star, because the truck moves locations and isn't always convenient to where you are.  (Though I favor the broadway in front of Fairway location!)Oh and the rich, thick, gooey chocolate sauce is utterly decadent, with syrupy strawberries too if you really want to make a mess.

I like the convenience, location, and the fact that it's quick and cheap. The waffle itself is crusty with great flavor, but nothing special. Good quick snack, but it's nothing to go out of your way for.

It's 2 a.m. and you're wobbling in your ridiculously impractical heels. You're tired, and all you want is to lay down in your nice fluffy bed. But then you smell waffles. And you see the yellow glow of the Wafels truck. And you're at attention. You're awake. And all you can think of is waffels. Sweet sweet waffles.Mini wafel, please. Ice cream on the side. And can you drizzle some chocolate fudge on that? Thanks! :) You giggle. You teeter on down the street with your delicious waffle creation. This is what perfection tastes like.

*LOOK FOR THE BRIGHT TONKA YELLOW TRUCK* OMG-how good are these "dinges"?  So I'm in SOHO trying to catch a cab downtown, during the shift change, 28 degrees out, wind chill blowing, and Rod not helping.....when all of a sudden I saw the yellow truck!  I told Rod to take over the cab situation, while I buy one of the wafels to try.  I asked the Wafel Master for his recommendation, he suggested the Liege Wafel.  I got the vanilla with just a sprinkle of sugar.  OMFG-it was sooooooo good, like sex in your mouth............All of a sudden it did not matter how frozen I was or that we needed a cab.  Buttery, sweet, chewy, slightly dense, a tad crunchy from the sugar crystals that burst in your mouth, and so scrumptious!  (My mouth is watering while I write this!)  Good thing we caught a cab shortly after I bought my wafel, cause I would've got another!An hour later, I was still salivating for another and was contemplating whether or not to go back and get one, and why the hell did I share it with Rod?!  I know-I'm sick, huh?  I really can NOT get enough of a good thing!I only had the simple Liege Wafel-I can't even begin to imagine how good it would be with dinges!!!

Oh Wafel Truck, why do you always disappoint me? You tell me that you'll be on 46th Street and 51st Street (I even signed up for a  twitter acct and added you to my speed dial for updates) and you are never where you'll say you'll be.The one and only time that I have gotten a wafel, it was entirely on coincident (and not in your usual spot), and I was heading to dinner. But I stuffed my face with a wafel in case our stars never cross again.And now you have that intriguing sweet pull pork wafel. When are we destined to meet again?

I usually get the liege waffle with spekuloos, whip cream, bananas, and strawberries. I personally think the fruits are necessary to mellow out the sugar from destroying your teeth. It's really good, especially the spekuloos. To me spekuloos is like a mix of peanut butter and nutella.Also their Iced coffee is really good with half and half. You can add sugar but when eating the waffle and drinking the coffee you honestly don't need the sugar because the waffle is sweet enough to sweeten the coffee.Although it may be very swwweeett, it's a good sweet. But I have to say, it's really hard to find these trucks sometimes!!

I'm leaving New York this weekend and all summer I'd been looking for this elusive truck.  Good thing I found it, because when the worker said it had sugar crystals inside, I knew it was true love.  $7 for a deliciously sweet waffle with their signature sauce and bananas.  It was sweet, it was filling, it was something I would eat every day for the rest of my life.  Could Wafels and Dinges just come to Midtown, like, every day and park outside of work?  Pls Hndl Thx.
These waffles are delicious. No other way to say it. I can't help but get one whenever I see one of these trucks.

My boss and I moved offices recently, and I was delighted to find out the W&D truck parks across the street from us every Friday morning. I like to support the local food carts/trucks, and had been meaning to try them for awhile but would always forget as I didn't walk by them on my morning commute. Now I had no excuse.I'm kicking myself from having not had it sooner... these are some amazing waffles. I was lucky enough to be the first customer of the day on my first visit, so my liege wafel was truly fresh off the grill-add to that bananas and spekuloos spread (a type of dark brown sugar cookie) and an instant Friday addiction was born. And that addiction is spreading...my two cube neighbors have also had one the past couple of times I've gone, and we're recruiting more coworkers into our Friday ritual each time we come back. You won't be disappointed.
Love the waffles!  "De Throwdown" is absolutely great tasting and I can't wait to go back and get a WMD - Waffles of Massive Deliciousness!

I stopped by on the way home from work after a long day. I expected perfection. They came close. The liege wafel was crunchy and chewy at the same time but wasn't as sweet as I had hoped. They get 5 stars since they came so close.

Really?  Seriously?  Are people rating Wafels & Dinges against other food trucks or is there some novelty built into the ratings?  We waited outside on the line for about 3 minutes.  The wafels are par-cooked and then reheated on the griddle for about 1 minute.  I understand the need for this at a truck but would you consider this great if you went to a restaurants and ordered wafels?  Thomas the owner in an email exchange told me that the Liege wafels are always cooked in this manner and reheated to obtain that crunchy pearl sugar texture.  The wafel was not crispy as others have mentioned.  I was told that you're supposed to wait 4 to 8 minutes in order to let the texture and pearl sugar develop.  The wafel tasted good but honestly no different than the other 50 American style waffles I've eaten in my life.  They doused the wafel with powered sugar and you could barely taste anything else which for me was the biggest sin.I have nothing against trucks or waffles.  I love them.  I just don't think there was anything special or necessarily good about the Wafels and Dinges truck.  Maybe if I let the Liege wafel sit for 4 to 8 minutes there will be a noticeable difference in both texture and pearl sugar flavorfulness.  I'll give them another try since everybody else seems to love this truck.

The waffles are AMAZING! Guys are nice as can be too. We trekked midtown just for this treat and it was worth it. Waffles are wonderfully crisp on the outside and moist on the inside. I added strawberries, bananas, spekuloos spread, whipped cream, and a scoop of spekuloos ice cream (should of gotten 2!). The dessert was pure perfection and if I lived in NYC I'd crave this treat every day.

Pricey but fun and tasty. We tried the brussels wafel with chocolate sauce, the liege wafel with bananas and strawberries, and the liege wafel with spekuloos spread.They were all really good. A bit pricey at $5 per wafel, first topping free, $1 for each additional topping...
Friendly, fun staff.  The small " wafels" are a great snack for a sweet tooth.

I went for International Waffle Day. They were having a deal that if you wore yellow, you got a free waffle + 1 topping. So I quickly made a wristband out of a yellow folder and ran down to find the truck. I had to have my fave, which has three toppings, so I still shelled out $2 for the extra two dinges. Brussels waffle with strawberries, bananas, and fudge. Just do it. So good. Anyway, I also stuffed a dollah in the tip jar since I was feeling so rich, getting a delish waffle for $2. The guy making the waffle asked the guy cooking the waffles which kind I had wanted, and the guy making the waffles motioned to four burnt-looking waffles sitting next to the waffle iron. Ummmm, okay. The guy took one of the burnt waffles, fixed it up with the dinges, and handed it to me. Now, my normal waffle eating strategy is to slide the waffle down to the edge, and just keep sliding it towards my mouth as I munch it down. However, this waffle wasn't sliding...and normally it's so crispy that it's hard to eat it with a fork. I used my fork, and a piece pulled off (it didn't *break* off) easily...because although it was burned on the top side, it was undercooked on the inside. So it was a little crispy, and mostly batter-y. I was like, "Oh, maybe it's because I got my waffle for free..." but there were PILES of beautifully fresh, perfectly riped strawberries and bananas on top! He certainly didn't skimp there! And they had been very friendly, too.So I was disappointed about the waffle, but the fruit really made up for it. Nothing pleases me more than good fruit, and I really got a lot of it. The waffle still *tasted* okay, but, I mean...waffles should be crispy. They shouldn't be easy to eat with a plastic fork. I know that they can do better, and I'll be back again so that I can give them five stars again, because that's what they deserve when they do it right.

Wafels and Dinges was absolutely delicious! Visited NYC from Cali in Februrary and knew we had to try Wafels and Dinges after watching them on Throwdon with Bobby Flay. The guy who worked at the wafel truck was super nice. Liege wafel + spekaloos + fresh strawberries + fudge = absolute deliciousness!!!! The wafel itself was quite messy to eat but it was sooo good! Wish they had one of these in California!

I specifically went to hunt down this truck. And I was expecting a line but to my surprise, only three people were there. It was a Friday afternoon and it's parked in a mostly business-y part of town. You can't miss the truck as it's a bright yellow. Two really upbeat guys were working in the truck. Everyone in front of me didn't specify which waffle they wanted and so they had to explain between the Belgium and the Liege. They must have to do this a million times a day yet they sounded really nice about it every time. Kudos to them. I would be so annoyed. It's on the menu, people. Anyways since I wasn't too hungry, I just got the Belgium, which is a lot lighter than the other one, with strawberries and powdered sugar. The waffle was five bucks. You get one topping or dingel for free and more will cost ya. They have like 10+ different dingels. The powdered sugar is free. They make the waffle when you order it so it comes out really fresh and hot. I loved it. My only minor complaint is that the waffle is not sweet at all. The sugar and berries and I'm sure, other toppings too, help with this. But yea, the liege is described as sweeter of the two. Next time I'm back in the city, I want to try the liege and the Bobby Flay one also. I remember seeing that episode too and didn't put two and two together that this was that particular truck. Oh and they currently have a semi-permanent location at the South Street Seaport so there's no need to go out of your way looking for the truck.

Before hopping on the train at Christopher/Sheridan, I was on the lookout for a filling dessert. 'Nuff respect to Mr. Softee and the like, but when the bright yellow Wafels & Dinges truck caught my eye, I knew it was a done deal. I got the Liege with Nutella and whipped cream...the combination was heavenly. The workers had a patient, welcoming vibe and good sense of humor. I appreciated getting the mini menu as I was leaving, because there's no doubt that I'll be back to try more.

I guess people really love the Wafels & Dinges truck, but it just wasnt for me.  The Belgian had an odd taste, kind of papery, and the liege had a great texture but was just too sweet for me.  I definitely chose the wrong toppings.  They were too thick and overwhelming and actually kind of grossed me out.  But dont let me scare you off, Im sure its just not my personal taste.  Check it out for yourself.  People seem to love em.

While the waffles (and dinges) are delicious, they do get messy - so it may not be the best idea to eat them while walking in Central Park while on a windy day.  You'll be humbly walking around with a ton of white powder all over you, but it's nothing an extra load of laundry detergent can't fix!

Mmm the pulled pork and waffle is such a great lunch choice. The pulled pork is so juicy that it melts through the waffle and creates an amazing mashup of goodness. That with a dessert waffle is an amazing combination on a sunny day.

On a sunny friday in August, me and some friends decided to have a cultural afternoon and went to the Metropolitan museum of Art in NYC. Alas, dear reader, for some unexplainable reason there was a 4 hour long waiting line to get  into the museum. Extremely dissapointed, we walked  downtown to get the train home because our whole presence in NYC didn't make sense anymore. But....Then we saw a small yellow waffle cart near the Apple Store at the entrance of Central Park. We all knew what this meant. God loved us. Because this little cart, although tiny and covered with weird black and white pictures, was our only way out of our depression. I ate the Liège waffle with Nutella and life seemed bright again. Thank you Wafels & Dinges to help me save money by avoiding counseling!

spekuloos all the way. please you can't resist that smell when you walk up the street and know it's a wafels and dinges cart.  so good but because it's so sweet and rich i have to be in the right mood for it.

I really do think this is as good as it gets.  I just walked to central park and saw this little delight there.  The 2 guys were funny and amusing especially when we've been waiting in line for a while.  I just got a regular waffle with maple syrup so I didn't get the whole experience.  The waffle was crispy and moist at the same time and the hot chocolate was the best thing ever to walk around a cold Central Park with.  If you see on in the area, stop by.  They're relatively cheap too.

Totally late review- we came to the truck last year for the brussels wafel with belgian chocolate fudge.  Man, it was SO good.  We had been to Belgium the year before so had the craving for some authentic wafel.  Wafels and dinges did not disappoint! I could already smell the wafels half way down the block.  It was so hard to choose what to get so I decided to keep it simple with the chocolate fudge.  The wafel was fresh, warm, slightly crispy with a ton of oozing, sweet, sticky chocolately goodness. It was a generous size and great for a before lunch snack.Overall highly recommend.  I've got to try some different toppings next time.Go again? Definitely the next time I'm in town, have to seek out the truck. Glad to hear they're stationed in central park now.
I picked the soft one, but I actually wanted the crispy one! Better luck next time.

This is one of my favorite places to grab food from on the go. My favorite would have to be the BBQ Pork Waffle which I guess is seasonal as they told me this weekend it'd be back in a few weeks. It sounds weird but you have to try it. It is bbq pulled pork on a crispy waffle with amazing cole slaw and a Koolickle (pickle brined in Kool-Aid). My advice is to fold it up and eat it like a sandwich. I've also had the Bacon and Syrup waffle which has bacon IN the batter and is just flat out amazing if you ask me. The guys are always friendly and welcoming and you can usually earn a free dinges if you follow their twitter and check out their feed for clues on how to snag a freebie.

HOLY AMAZING WAFFLES BATMAN.  Crispy and sweet and ever-so-slightly carmelized. I had the Throwdown Wafel (which, unsurprisingly after eating it, beat Bobby Flay).  Also hear there's a bbq pork one that is amazing but apparently rarely available, so if it is when you visit, it sounds like it's worth a try. The Spekuloos spread was unbelievable - I don't live in New York so I'm glad they sell jars of it online!  I will be tracking them down next time I'm in town!
heck yeah!!!!!hunt this thing down, you'll be glad you did. and trust that you don't even need to put anything on these waffles, they're spectacular just the way the waffle truck made them.

I'm starting to become a big fan of food trucks in the Manhattan/Queens area, so I had to try the famous Waffles & Dinges.  It just happens to be up the block from my office on Thursdays, so I made my way over there in the morning for sweet breakfast.  There were just a few people on line when I got there, so I ordered and got my food rather quickly.There are 2 waffle types you can order, which is explained on their menu on the truck - the light crispy or the soft chewy.  I went with the 'deThrowdown' (i think that's how it's spelled) on the soft chewy waffle.  It's the name comes from the show Bobby Flay's Throwdown, which it was featured on.  It comes with their homemade spread -spekulous (taste like teddy graham's crackers) and whip cream.  As for the taste....it was freakin delicious, well at least the first 10 bites.  By the time I was almost finished with it I was getting nauseous, since I'm not used to eating something so sweet.  Nonetheless, it was well worth the nausea and 1,000+ calories I took down.  If I had no regard for my health, I'd probably be eating from this truck everyday until I get sick of it.  The waffle by itself or with just 1 non-sweet topping alone is probably really good considering the healthy amount of sugar they probably use in the batter.  I'll be eating from them again in a couple of weeks, and this time I plan on getting strawberries, bananas, walnuts, and peanut butter as my toppings....damn, my mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Definitely recommend trying out this truck but be warned, it can be VEEEERY SWEET.

I wanted to love this truck so badly, I really dida) because I love wafflesb) because its been hyped all over town (plus the internet and TV)and c) because the idea of a truck dedicated solely to waffles just sounds awesomeUnfortunately the waffle truck that I had built up in my mind does not exist . In theory the waffles would be fresh, hot, and slightly sweet satisfying perfection. In reality they were RAW in the middle, and no not jut a little bit soft; I'm talking straight up raw waffle dough with a slightly cooked edge (a $6 mound of dough) . My friend and I were so disappointed that we ended up licking the spekuloos spread off of our waffles and throwing them away. The spekuloos spread, however I will concede, was amazingly delicious and is what constitutes my 2 star rating. A good idea with lots of hype will only take you so far. What really matters is delivering a quality product to your consumers. Perhaps I'll try another waffel one day, but for now i'm totally turned off and i wish that I would have kept my waffle hopes a dream instead of making them into a palate disappointing reality
WMD - Wafel of Massive Deliciousness. 5 stars. Potentially better than WMD - Women with Massive Double-Ds.

3 1/2 stars. Now I don't know if the food can live up to its "orgasmic" name, but they are definitely good waffles. They are fluffy, airy even, but still has a bit of a crunch on the outside. They are also freshly made right in front of your eyes, with fresh fruits, which made it at least semi-healthy. But at $5-6 a shot, I expect it to be incredible, and these waffles, despite having great combinations, were just okay for me.
Amazing.. and the staff was super friendly, and helpful on my first visit, tonight!!! Do yourself a favor.. hunt them down and try this stuff!!!
I don't do truck food but I was curious when my classmate couldn't stop bragging about how good it was so I went ahead and gave it a try. It was by far the best waffle I ever had. Two THUMBS up!!!

I am a waffle snob. Having traveled to Belgium before and eaten true honest to goodness Belgian waffles, I have been trying to find a place in the US that can replicate the exact flavour. Although the Wafels and Dinges truck is good, it doesn't replicate the flavour exactly. Could this be a regional difference (well Belgium is quite small...) or could it be a recipe difference? Probably the latter. I ordered the liege wafel w/ nutella. Overall, quite good, but lacked the authentic flavour that I sought out. Really 3.5 stars, but because of the reheating factor (although not quite the biggest deal) made the wafels not as "fall apart" able (not a word, but the ones in Belgium fall apart more easily).Would go back to yearn for the taste of delicious wafels, but more yearning to go back to Belgium :)

I have tried several times to get to one of these trucks in the city but have never been close enough. Luckily I went to the Food Truck Wars held in the Monmouth Race park and there it was!!! That beautiful yellow truck. I waited about 40 minutes to have a taste of heaven! I had a waffle with belgian chocolate fudge, strawberries and whipped cream. Lets just say that waffle never stood a chance. I have to say the staff was very friendly. I dont think I would have been able to be as friendly with the amount of people they served that day.

All I can say is that the WMD should be renamed OMG.  Total deliciousness!  Treats were so yummy and the guys in the cart were friendly and joked around with our kids, who performed "The Itsy Bitsy Spider" for free dinges.  I recommend following them on Twitter for free dinges and locations.

BEST WAFFLES - wait -  WAFELS EVER!!! No wonder this truck beat Bobby Flay in Throwdown, their waffles are delish.  Moist inside, crispy outside, tons of toppings (nutella and strawberry for me =)).  Only thing I wish they did was set up something semi-permanent in the Seaport - since I always seem to miss them there.

So I FINALLY got to taste this truck!  I first saw them on the Food Network with Bobby Flay and I LOVE Bobby Flay so I knew it was going to be good. They were only 2 blocks from my job which I was very happy about and  I was so excited walking there I could hardly contain myself!  I had seen the show, read so many reviews and looked at the pictures that I already knew exactly what I wanted to try and that was the liege wagel with the special "speckulous" sauce with strawberries and whip cream!! I walked up to the truck (by the way the guys were so friendly) like a pro and ordered my wafel and it was ready in no time! I practically ran back to my desk to sit down and try my wafel and it did not dissapoint!  It was really really good, I loved it, however it was just a little too much for me that about 2/3rd of the way I was pretty much done with and was so full but I refused to throw the remaining portion away and forced myself to finish.  I'm definitely going back to try out some other stuff (pulled pork with cole slaw) but I think I'll bring my sis along so I can share, I cannot force myself again that was too indulgent and as good as it was I didn't like the way I felt afterward lol
Seriously one of the tastiest things I've ever eaten.   Waffle, spekuloos, nutella, strawberry, banana.  Insanely delicious.

wow, totally happened on this truck by accident... i saw the yellow truck parked in cooper square and decided that i was looking for a random dessert truck that i vaguely remembered hearing about somewhere (yes, i clearly had my foodie act together). anyway, realized that 1) this was not in fact the dessert truck that had been there before but 2) lucky me, it was freakin' awesome!!was on the run so didn't have time to do a full scan of menu and notes, but we ordered two wafels, one of the light and crispys, one of the soft and chewys, both of which were delicious (the light and crispy is probably more impressive in its harmony of crispy outside and soft inside). one was topped with nutella and one with dulce de leche, and both were dusted with powdered sugar and little stairways to heaven. damn, we pounded that shit in seriously under 5 minutes, and that's only because i was slicing them into thirds to be shared and we were running for the subway. and because i was distracted by the flat screen TV hanging above the service counter playing the foodtv episode where this cart was on bobby flay throwdown (first time i've been to a throw down place - holla!) i vow to return and order several more (and get them topped with ice cream!) and be able to sit down and enjoy versus acting like a small starving child. you need to get on this stuff like a fat kid on cake.

Great little shop that I tried on the outskirts of Central Park.  I saw a line from a distance in 22 degree weather so I had to check it out.  The waffles were sweet with a nice crunch and no sogginess whatsoever (considering mine had a large scoop of vanilla on top with chocolate spread also).

Heard lots of reviews about this place and been trying to find the time to go to where they are located at for the day for 2 weeks now and finally on Saturday I had it and it is by far the best. Maybe it was the anticipation of getting it but boy when I got there and smelled it a block away, my stomach instantly wanted it.  I got the Brussels wafel with the Belgium chocolate, with strawberries and banana and whipped cream and my gf got the nutella and strawberries and we got the Belgium hot coco... very delicious and the employees are very entertaining and held up a conversation oppose to other places where they shove the order in front of you and move you along.  Altogether it was worth my trip from Jersey on a weekend to go to Brooklyn and get to this truck. Will look forward to going back and bringing my friends with me.  Can't wait for it to get warmer so I can throw some ice cream on top of this.  On top that they just beat Bobby Flay in the throwdown that aired last week ! Go Wafels and Dinges!

One of the best desserts I've had in NYC. The waffles are deliciously crisp. I usually go for speculoos, banana, strawberry, walnuts and nutella. Yup, that's pretty much 90% of the toppings they have. DO NOT forget  to add the speculoos spread irrespective of the other toppings you choose. It's very very good.

Amazing! Best street food I've ever had. The pulled pork waffle was better than any pulled pork sandwich I've ever eaten and the Cole slaw that was on it was delicious, too. That was my savory waffle (who knew waffles could be savory?). For my sweet waffle I went with the liege with spekuloos spread. Oh man, the liege was so dense and sweet and the spekuloos has kind of a honey icing taste to it. Incredible. I'll be back. In fact, I might hide out in the back and just go where the truck goes.
really really tasty treat. i hate that i live so close to this cart. it is heaven yet it is the devil. jerks.
My fav food truck in NY. Every time I find out that I am REMOTELY near the Wafel & Dinges truck, I do anything in my power to get it! Delicious. Follow them on Twitter to find out their location.
Great treat in the middle of the day when they are near my office. Love the Twitter updates they offer. Truck food tens to make me very happy.

Thank heaven they are only in Dumbo once a week and it is on a Monday, most people go out to dinner & overindulge on weekends (or at least i do) so on Monday i really don't feel like eating anything too rich. If this truck was in Dumbo on a Friday OMG, i would be in trouble, i'd need a larger sized wardrobe. I attempted to go to starbucks on Front st, there was no parking & the line was about 10 people deep so no shot of a quick dbl park and running in for a cup of Joe. Fortunately construction did not allow me to take my normal route to work, i wound up having to loop around only to stumble upon the "truck", which i remember from throwdown w/ bobby flay and to my surprise a parking spot right behind the truck. i stopped, ordered a cup of coffee and the throwdown wafel, went back to my car and indulged, i quickly called my foodie friends from work, i sent them a picture of this piece of heaven and demanded that they come downstairs and get in my car so i could escort them to this truck that serves pieces of paradise. They obliged and we headed back, i made my suggestion to follow in my footsteps and order the 'throwdown" wafel, Emery did, i watched as he took his 1st bite, his eyes closed as if he was whisked away on a mini vacation as he chewed. As I, he did not believe anything could taste so delicious, Cesar went a little overboard, he got a wafel with ice cream, whipped cream, berries, chocolate syrup, bananas, nuts etc. he too enjoyed it very much. i can not say enough about this wonderful experience and look forward to starting a W&D religion, after one bite, getting followers will be a cinch. Lastly, their coffee is amazing as well....***UPDATE 8/9/2010*** I just wanted to add to my review as to be fair. 2 weeks after my 1st experience i continued to talk about it to the point that my fiancée insisted i take her for wafels & dinges, she has a liege with strawberry, banana & maple syrup & a belgium hot chocolate, which was insanely thick and chocolaty . I, once again had a coffee & a throwdown wafel and it was once again, GREAT!!! BUT, the following Monday i was driving to work and found myself in that bad place again,  Front st, DUMBO, i said i would pass and see if i found parking, which i did. i ordered a Brussels wafel with Nutella & of course a large coffee. The coffee & service were good, the Brussels wafel was okay, i wasn't knocked out of my chair like i was with the throwdown liege wafel.....My advice, go with the liege........period!

oh man oh man oh man, out of the many vendors in the city, Wafels & Dinges has got to be my favorite. 1- The wafels taste sweet and they are warm. (plus they're soft in the center which i love)2- if you follow them on twitter ( twitter.com/waffletruck ), you can find out the secret password of the day to get more "dinges" (toppings)3- where else in the city can you get spekuloos? no where except the wafel truck. when you go, you actually have to get it. it's like nutella and cinnamon toast crunch had a child together.4- the people who work in the truck, the waffelers, are so friendly and helpful. when i go, i bring a friend, and we are always talking to them5- right now, you need to get off your computer and go to the wafel truck

DE-LICIOUS. And somehow they always seem to be parked in the area I happen to be in at the time... but I'm not complaining. The person serving you will likely convince you to try the speculoos on your waffle. I was pretty skeptical at first too (seriously, speculoos?!) but am now the biggest believer. My go-to is nutella, speculoos, and strawberries. Try it and you'll thank me later.
Their  liege waffle is amazing :).  dont forget to get WMD for unlimited topping.  I need one every time i see them :p

So light.... So crispy... So good... Mmm~W&D knows how to make good waffles.  I ordered the Brussels Wafels with Sekuloos spread and fresh cut strawberries, and it really hit the spot. The taste is still lingering in my mouth.  The waffles are a bit overpriced, especially for truck food, but it's worth every penny. I will definitely be going back.

Wow.  I've been looking for a decent alternative ever since my first gaufre (french for waffle, cuz I'm cool like that) at the Musee D'Orsay in Paris - which, in my opinion is one of the best you'll find while your there.   In Paris, I choose to eat them plain or with just a touch of sugar because - let's face it - they're better then any waffles you'll find here (someone prove me wrong, please).  Since my work schedule/bank acct won't allow me to travel to Paris every time the waffle craving strikes, Wafels & Dinges is my new go-to on these occassions.  And bonus - their spekuloos is something those Parisians don't have.  Top that with a few sliced strawberries and I'm good to go.

Whenever I go this is the highlight of my day.  In terms of waffles they are delicious.  The toppings I typically order are a scoop of vanilla ice cream, walnuts and dulce de leche.  This combination is awesome and I highly recommend it.  My coworkers typically get nutella and a liege waffle also seem to be very good.  The prices are good, the quality of the food is very high and the people in the truck are nice.  If you have the opportunity to go I highly recommend that you do.  It's a wonderful and delicious experience.

omg this is waffle heaven!  petite abeille, this place has you beat!can waffles get any better than this? their waffles are fresh and made right in front of you  The brussels waffle and warm and light and just heavenly delicious, add to that some nutella (bestest chocolate sauce ever invented), fresh strawberries, and whip cream and you've got yourself a dessert/snack/afternoon treat that will blow any other waffle you've ever had out of this world!The guys who work in the truck are extremely helpful and extra nice so if you have any questions, they are more than willing to help.  If you see this truck, get yourself a waffle!

Got there this morning only to find the truck not opened for business because some state official car took over their usual spot. I was so mad! But before the truck moved to another spot they served me a waffle since I told them I made the trip there JUST for their waffles!! Thank you!
Wafles and Dinges just rocks. Look for Spekuloos in Stone and Bone Trading Company's Best of NYC Holiday Gift baskets!

I got a liege waffle with nutella.  Honestly, put nutella on anything, and it's pretty hard to go wrong.  The waffle itself...it was good.  But I kept dreaming about these liege waffles I had in Paris with pearl sugar crunching between my teeth with every bite...that is what I wanted here.  I didn't get the texture of the pearl sugar, which made me sad.  But it was still delicious!

If you come across the waffle truck while wandering around drunk, it is probably the best thing to happen, ever. Plus, they'll give you a bonus topping if you check their twitter before arriving and perform whatever action they have on there for that day (usually hilarious and related to current events). Not to mention, the guys are all very nice and have a great sense of humor. It's a little pricey for a tiny waffle, but the experience is worth it, I think.

I can't add much to what everyone else has said.Get the cinnamon vanilla with NUTELLA AND STRAWBERRIES. And you will want to lick everything with nutella on it cleannn. I couldn't not stop before dinner, so we had our dessert first. Crunchy outside, chewy inside, Just like they should be.And the guys on there are always so sweet, so lots of +'s for them and the delicious carbs they grant new yorkers with.
Definitely a fan!  In addition to their fresh warm waffles and toppings, their service has always been great and personable - hard to find in this big city! :)

How have I not reviewed this place before?I discovered Wafels and Dinges in October and decided to try it after seeing it on Throw Down. It was so amazing that when they had a booth at the Union Square Holiday Market, I had to stop by once a week. In total, I've probably eaten at 3 of their different locations a half a dozen times and have been satisfied every time.The liege wafel is heavenly with any of the toppings. Chewy, crispy, delicious. I also want to date every person who works there because of how friendly and attentive they are even at their busiest times.
Must must cart eats in nyc.

Had a wafel with spekuloos and Belgian chocolate fudge at their pop-up shop near Madison Sq Park. It was de li cious!  The booth bitch wasn't lying when he said spekuloos was made of orgasms and crack and the bible... But really, it's like a gingerbread-y, rich, delicious, CRACK. With chocolate, and a warm, toasty gooey wafel, the perfect dessert.

This wonderful truck happened to be at Gantry Park in Long Island City, so I had the opportunity to try their amazing waffles and dinges! Oh my were they wonderful! I had ordered the special one that they competed with Bobby Flay on his Throwdown show and it was awesome. The waffles are chewy with a crispy outside and the spookulous sauce was amazing. I highly recommend you try this stuff if you ever get the chance. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

I really don't get the hype. I've had Wafels & Dinges twice, and I still don't understand what everyone raves about. The first time I had a waffle with nutella and strawberries, and I thought it was just very standard and overpriced.  The second time I had a waffle with spekuloos, and I wasn't impressed. The entire waffle was more dense than fluffy, and didn't seem to have any oomph factor. Pass.

I dont really like Belgium Waffles that much but decided to try them.   I had the DaBomb and I am craving more.  I asked for the ice cream on the side; the chocolate was hot, but hard when I got home.  It was amazing!  I am still thinking of it now.  I will now try to avoid the truck since I will have to buy it every time.  Treat yourself!!!
Awesome as usual!! Love them! Drove 45 minutes today to get to them. It's also the last night to use your groupon. So it's a madhouse. Get here if you can tonight before 10:00pm.
they're so awesome- i don't think my review even matters.used to visit them for lunch when i was worked on water street. yes- it was my lunch. brusself waffle with spekuloos spread.

Do you want to spoil yourself and host a glorious party in your stomach?!  Come here! haha.  Don't let the truck fool you. Eat dessert first!  :)Their wafles are to die for.  We had two kinds of wafel, a liege which is a dough based batter, chewy with a little bit of sugar crystals and a brusels wafel which is light and crispy.  A brusels wafel is the battered wafel that most of us are familiar with. Leige wafel...a true Belgian wafel is in the familiar square shape! Try their spekulous spread...it's delicious!  I wish I could come here every day for breakast or have breakfast for every meal!  OMG, I need to move...

Now, before you pass any judgement, I still don't, and probably won't, EVER agree to the compatibility between fried chicken and waffles.With that being said--the waffles from Wafels & Dinges are to die for. I ordered their "de Throwdown wafel" and it's their liege waffle topped with gingerbread spread. Although they listed whip cream as a topping, they actually forgot to top my waffle with the liquid poison. And I'm thankful for that. Now, I stumbled upon this truck after a massive dinner, but because this truck was one of my "to-do-in-NYC" list, I couldn't pass up the opportunity. I bought the waffle that evening and safely placed it in the fridge. The next morning for breakfast, I took a thirsty "bite" at the waffle. My eyes widened and my nostrils flared. I was hestitant that the waffle had gone stale, or even worse, soggy. But nope. It's none of that. The waffle still had it's crunch and the taste isn't lacking at all! The lingering sweet taste of the belgian waffle is different from your typical Eggo. No no no, Wafels & Dinges liege waffles surpass that by 5 football fields. I'm not surprised that this waffle beat Bobby Flay (Sorry Bobby, but you're still my boy!) Now I'll never know how the waffles taste freshly made...but it's definitely a reason for me to go back ASAP--well definitely for their waffles AND for another glace at the super hot server with his accent!

There are so many reasons this place deserves four stars.1) It's a magical, yellow bus that appears out of nowhere and brings you priceless gobs of joy in a little paper tray for pocket change.2) They are actual Belgian Waffles (or shall I say, Waffels?).3) If God ate breakfast, this would be His guilty pleasure.4) The guy uses Twitter to announce his location -- technologically advanced while maintaining traditional Belgian awesomeness.5) They will give you Nutella by the spoonful if you're nice.But then there are bad things as well.1) There's always a line.2) There's nowhere to eat it after you get it. Not a real problem for me  because I'm a guy but a real problem for most New York females.3) Sure $7 is a small price to pay for this kind of bliss, but $7 adds up and bliss fades quickly.4) Once, the machine was broken so I couldn't even order the type of waffle I wanted and on top of that, the guy got the order I didn't really want anyways completely wrong. Thankfully, I was hungry and if you put whipped cream on anything, I consider it edible.Since I can't give it 3.5 stars, I'm going to go with 3. It's a treat and all, but if they didn't come to me, I wouldn't go to them.

I found this stand at the Union Square Holiday Holiday Market... I had the liege wafel with the spekuloos spread and bananas- The spekuloos is AMAZING! I'm not usually a fan of waffles, but this has converted me =)Looking forward to following the truck and trying their dulce de leche & nutella waffles!

I've always heard of the Wafel & Dinges truck that goes around NY but never got a chance to track it down and try it out. The company I work for got the Wafels & Dinges truck as a private catering service and my chance to try out their food was finally at hand!I ended up getting their Wafels of Mass Delicious and got a ton of toppings added on. After I gave my order I eagerly await my treats and then I heard my name being called. The waffles were just freaking delicious and I was totally shocked at how good it was. It was so great that I ended up getting another one from the truck (being that it was free) and had a good time.If you see this truck around in the city, PLEASE take a moment and grab yourself a waffle.
Wafels make the heart grow fonder. A world where a truck can pull up and serve an excellent waffle to a random happy drunkard is a world that I am proud to live in.

OK, I take it back.  After reading my initial 3-star review, the owner of the wafeltruck contacted me and first made sure that I was actually talking about his wafeltruck-- beware!  there's an impostor wafeltruck around town!-- and then assured me that some of my issues (namely the bad hot chocolate) were teething pains the truck was going through last year and that it was worth giving the truck another shot. He even said I could get a free topping if I tried again.So I subscribed to their twitter feed (!) to see when our locations would cross again and, lo and behold, found out that they tend to set up camp in Midtown on weekdays mere blocks from where I work.  This review would be 4.5 stars if it could because I tried going to the truck twice before having any success-- both times the truck said it'd be at it's locale until 4pm and both times I tried going around 3:40 and they were already gone.  I'm sure it ain't easy to secure a parking space in midtown for a day, but if you're gonna depart before you say you're going to depart, at least update your Twitter feed for those who rely on it to get your whereabouts!Third time's a charm.  When I finally got to the truck, i was rewarded with a delicious waffle as described by so many reviewers before me here for $4.  And many days they give you a code via their twitter feed for a free topping-- it would behoove you to check the feed.  I got me the brussels wafel with nutella; next time I'll give their liege a second try.
OMG...THES BEST WAFLES EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I wish we had something like this here in LA/OC.  I never ever had one tasted so heavenly.  I would def come back next time when i visit NYC.

Delicious, piping hot waffles with a wonderfully sweet, crunchy exterior and great chocolate sauce. When I ordered a waffle with fudge sauce, I was prepared for Hershey's syrup, but believe me, it was real chocolate. The only problem was...it was super messy to eat on the street. I had powdered sugar all over me, and chocolate on my lips, but...that didn't stop the jealous glances from nonwaffleholders.

After seeing the Bobby Flay Throwdown, we finally found the Truck.  We had to call a toll free number to find it's locaton.  There is a hint on the message how to get a free dinges (topping).  The Liege Waffle with the Spekloos and whipped cream.  It's tough to eat standing up with one hand holding the paper box the wafel is served on.  This wafel is thick chewy and it's touch to cut.  Dare I try to eat it like a pizza.  I could, but it would be messy.  Now I know what it tastes like, I'm going to try to make my own at home.

I had been meaning to try wafels & dinges for quite some time, but I never got around to it. Then, one random morning, it was magically parked right outside the bf's apartment in Williamsburg. Could there be a clearer sign? I was obviously meant to try W&D - if the mountain (me) won't come to Mohammad (W&D), Mohammad must go to the mountain. :D It was that fateful day I first tried the delicious wafels this truck offers. The wafel is crisp and crunchy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside, and the combination results in a wonderfully chewy goodness. Cue in dinges/toppings: strawberries and spekuloos spread for me. The fruit is fresh and they don't skimp out by giving you just a few pieces. The spekuloos sauce was really good! It tastes like a combination of peanut butter, nutella, and chocolate. I'm so glad I got to try it! Next time, spekuloos, fruit, and ice cream - it's going to be wild.

AMAZING!!! I'M so lucky the truck was right outside of columbia and giving out free wafels for an event! AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING! the wafels are perfectly chewy and crispy. and the toppings were generously given!

Walking to class along Broadway I used to see lines outside this strange yellow truck with a Belgian flag.  One day I thought to check Yelp and said to myself "I have to try this."Fast forward 4 months and I've become a regular.  Coming back from lectures I'd pick up a brussels waffle topped with strawberries and nutella.  I never thought I'd eat another waffle in my life.Then this week checking my twitter feed (I had followed @waffletruck) I saw that Bobby Flay -- yes Food Network's resident douche-chef Bobby Flay -- had challenged Wafels & Dinges to a throwdown.  In the episode you see W&D using pearl sugar to give their liege waffles proper caramelization.  Apparently liege waffles have a doughy consistency that is damned near impossible to perfect.  Time to mix up my brussels routine.Prognosis?  I'd rate 6 stars if I could.  5 stars for the waffle, and an additional star for beating Bobby Flay on his own show.

I found the waffle truck on the UWS a few weekends ago. Since I went with two other people I got to try a bit of each kind of waffle! Sorry, wafel.My favorite of the three is the cinnamon liege, definitely. The liege wafel is dense and more sugary than the regular Belgian wafel and the cinnamon makes it so you don't even need to heap any toppings--dinges--on it. I got strawberries on my regular liege and enjoyed it, but I might have also preferred it w/ nothing or just powdered sugar. The regular one is probably the one that most needs a topping. I will definitely be on the lookout for the truck again, though maybe on a less rainy/cold day when it's actually nice to sit outside and eat it.

Forget about the ice cream truck: This is the one you want to chase! Any food truck tasty enough to justify having it's own hotline so you can pinpoint it's exact location is worth trying (Btw hold onto this, you'll thank me later: 866.429.7329 :) The Nutella wafel was delish & the legendary "Spekuloos spread" was phenomenal: A cinnamony, clovey, nutmeggy yumminess unlike anything I've tried before.

I welcome every gut wrenching stomach ache I get after eating a liege waffle, spackled with speckuloos, topped with two scoops of vanilla ice cream, and sprinkled with powdered sugar. The quad-fecta of this decadent delight is so ridiculously radical that I would be fine with getting ass raped by an orangutan just as long as I was promised a trip to Wafels & Dinges after wards.

ok nothing so special...i think the petite abilene is so much better and you get to seat there too. I saw them at bobby's flay throwdown and thought they were really good but went there with my friend and thought it was okay. I like STREET SWEET TRUCK so much better than Wafels & Dinges.
Oh yum yum yum!!! So delicious! And the staff is sooo nice! Thanks!

Fantastic!  Best waffles we've ever had.  I was in from out of town with my wife and kids aged 6 and 5.  We monitored their location via Twitter the week we were in town and were lucky enough to catch them in Midtown East area near our hotel.  We split the Throwdown and the light belgian waffle with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Got the spekuloos on both which is one of the best tasting and most unique spreads I've ever had.  Highly highly recommended.  We actually bought two jars of the spread to bring back home with us on the plane.
craving BBQ, I tried the waffle topped with BBQ pulled pork/cole slaw, garnished with a thick slice of pickle marinated in cherry Cool Aid, excellent!

Oh my lord. Saw this place on a tv show on TLC about food trucks and I knew I had to try it. Went there yesterday with my wife and friends, and we couldn't be happier. I had the pulled pork waffle. I know it sounds strange, but it comes together well. The sweetness of the waffle, the saltiness of the pork, and the bitterness from the coleslaw was off the hook. My wife had a waffle with bacon and maple syrup in it. It was kind of like a mcgridle on crack. My friends had the WMD ( waffle of massive deliciousness). It's basically a waffle with unlimited toppings (dinges). I'd repeat over and over if I didn't have to take a 2-1/2 hour flight to get there.

I've located Wafels & Dinges numerous times in the city and everything they offer is AMAZING!! I usually get the Liège wafel with strawberries and Spekuloos(which you have to try). They make them on the spot so they are still nice and warm when you dig in. Last time we were there my boyfriend got the pulled pork wafel and he said it was great. If you are in the city near one of their locations you have to go!!

It is hard to put more descriptions in how freakingly awesome these things are - you just have to search this place out and try em. You will come back hell I live in Jersey and I'v driven my family in on a Sunday, parked, eaten and driven back! I'm kinda glad it's not too close or I'd probably be the size of house by now. Smply The Best

If you quoted Jack Nicholson, last Wednesday you could get a free dinges on your waffle.  So quote in mind my friend and I set out from the depths of the Bronx for a delicious piece of waffley heaven.   We get to 52nd between 6th and 7th, and realise that there is a crowd of girls ordering waffles also. I start thinking about the quote I chose, and tell myself that this quote needs to be shouted, it needs emotion, it can't just be whispered meekly. My friend and I step up to the counter to make our orders, and inquire if they're still accepting quotes for dinges. They tell us that they are, and that they are ready for our quotes; I start to panic slightly because this gaggle of girls is still standing nearby, and I know that they will think I am some sort of insane person when I start yelling at the waffle dude, so I try to get my friend to go first, she tells me to go first. I take a deep breath and begin  "Wendy? Darling? Light of my life!...." the waffle man gets a big smile on his face and tells me to keep going,and I can feel my cheeks turning red and my hands shaking, but I want free dinges so badly that I continue on and finally finish with a "I'm just going to bash your brains in". Of  course my friend chose a much shorter, and calmer quote from A Few Good Men. The waffles were so worth my embarrassment, chewy and covered in belgian hot fudge and strawberries. My mouth, and belly were so happy.

Delicious, waffle is hot and soft. I really like Ice cream with cookies, they two make the best desert..chocolate is too sweet, and strawberry..I saw bugs on..anyway, they are very nice, and let me try different flavor.
Oh my goodness!  This was such a delightful treat!! I got a wafel with spekuloos, strawberries, hot fudge, and whipped cream and have not stopped thinking about it since.  Highly recommend!

I don't know what the hell a "dinges" is a plural reference to, but whatever it is, it's freaking amazing. First "dinges" = free. My friend got the dulce leche. It's pretty small for $5 but it's 5 minutes of sheer bliss: crispy outer edges of the waffle, perfectly chewy, fried batter, warm, and topped with the best sweet things.

does this delectable food truck need another review?  no but im going to review it anyway because i just had one tonight and boy did it put a smile in my tummy.  located right outside the NY FILM CAFE in a hard-to-miss bright yellow truck, waffles and dinges always has a small line of drooling custies just waiting to fill their mouths with yummy, crunchy, gooey belgian waffles.  i have not had their "savory" selection of waffles yet (waffles with MEAT-chili, bacon, pulled pork) but their "sweet" section alone can put dennys, ihop, friendly's (is that even still around) out of business.  spekuloooos i love it i love it. it has a gingery, honey taste but the bad thing is it leaves a weird aftertaste.  get a wafle, for 2$ you can get unlimited toppings (whipped cream, chocolate, nutella, strawberry, banana, etc)  and it is FRESH.  i saw the guy cut my strawberries up right in front of me.  waffles are made to order, take about 2-3 minutes and then... heaven.

I was skeptical of waffles being a good dessert, but this place is amazing! You can get all the toppings you want and they will not skimp. You gotta try their unique spread that tastes like graham crackers. You've never tried anything like it.
I crave the spekuloos spread.... add that on top of the "de bacon & syrup" wafel and you got heaven in a box.

GO BIG OR GO HOME!That's what this truck is all about. Dammit if I don't love the street food. This is such a "non-thing" where I come from because everyone drives to their destinations but when people are walking, you bring the food to them, on their level. BRILLIANT! Hence the lack of drive-thrus in New York and the too damn many in LA.My first waffle ever was long ago (a year maybe...) and I was accompanied by Rob L. and Javier M. And I did not feel the love. I didn't know the password for the day so I couldn't get a free topping and I wasn't really sure about how to go about the whole thing since I had been reading about it but wasn't making a purposeful trip to the truck. We just found it in the West Village hanging out by that Starbucks I like so much on Christopher and decided to give it a whirl. I was non-plussed. So much so that I didn't even write a review.Last night was different. I was craving waffle. I have been following the truck on twitter for a couple months now and everyday they tell me where they are. Sometimes, just a couple blocks from my job! They spend many evenings in front of Trader Joe's and since it was on the way to Webster Hall I went ahead and stopped under the awning to fulfill my craving. I had a Wafel of Massive Deliciousness. YES! All the toppings you want. 7 bucks! I went for the light and crispier of the two wafels. And had my chef put strawberries, blueberries, whipped cream, marshmallows, and powdered sugar on top. I think even he was impressed with my order. Oh yeah baby! hehehehe. It was great. The wafel was kind of warm so it did this sort of melt in your mouth thing. I indulged in my WMD around the corner from the truck on 3rd Avenue behind the bus stop so the raindrops wouldn't ruin my experience. It was a wee bit-o-heaven as I devoured my goodness.Mmmmmhmmm. More waffletruck please!

Finally ate here for the first time today with the wifey.  These guys running the truck (UES location) are super nice and the food is pretty good.  Tried the new Spekuloos (a nutella like spread with graham cracker flavor instead) spread and bananas on a liege waffle. Delicious! Will definitely eat here again :)

The waffles are as good as everybody said it would be. I got the Belgian waffles with dulce de leche and it was YUM! They are very close to the waffles I've had in Belgium. I will go back to try a waffle with Spekuloos next time.
